loc_cmake_android_arch_abi: When Cross Compiling for Android, this variable specifies the target architecture and ABI to be used. Valid values are:
loc_cmake_android_arm_mode: When Cross Compiling for Android and CMAKE_ANDROID_ARCH_ABI is set to one of the armeabi architectures, set CMAKE_ANDROID_ARM_MODE to ON to target 32-bit ARM processors (-marm). Otherwise, the default is to target the 16-bit Thumb processors (-mthumb).
loc_cmake_android_arm_neon: When Cross Compiling for Android and CMAKE_ANDROID_ARCH_ABI is set to armeabi-v7a set CMAKE_ANDROID_ARM_NEON to ON to target ARM NEON devices.
loc_cmake_android_assets_directories: Default value for the ANDROID_ASSETS_DIRECTORIES target property. See that target property for additional information.
loc_cmake_android_exceptions: When Cross Compiling for Android with the NDK, this variable may be set to specify whether exceptions are enabled.
loc_cmake_android_gui: Default value for the ANDROID_GUI target property of executables. See that target property for additional information.
loc_cmake_android_jar_dependencies: Default value for the ANDROID_JAR_DEPENDENCIES target property. See that target property for additional information.
loc_cmake_android_jar_directories: Default value for the ANDROID_JAR_DIRECTORIES target property. See that target property for additional information.
loc_cmake_android_java_source_dir: Default value for the ANDROID_JAVA_SOURCE_DIR target property. See that target property for additional information.
loc_cmake_android_native_lib_dependencie: Default value for the ANDROID_NATIVE_LIB_DEPENDENCIES target property. See that target property for additional information.
loc_cmake_android_native_lib_directories: Default value for the ANDROID_NATIVE_LIB_DIRECTORIES target property. See that target property for additional information.
loc_cmake_android_ndk: When Cross Compiling for Android with the NDK, this variable holds the absolute path to the root directory of the NDK. The directory must contain a platforms subdirectory holding the android-<api> directories.
loc_cmake_android_ndk_deprecated_headers: When Cross Compiling for Android with the NDK, this variable may be set to specify whether to use the deprecated per-api-level headers instead of the unified headers.
loc_cmake_android_ndk_toolchain_host_tag: When Cross Compiling for Android with the NDK, this variable provides the NDK's "host tag" used to construct the path to prebuilt toolchains that run on the host.
loc_cmake_android_ndk_toolchain_version: When Cross Compiling for Android with the NDK, this variable may be set to specify the version of the toolchain to be used as the compiler.
loc_cmake_android_ndk_version: When Cross Compiling for Android with the NDK and using an Android NDK version 11 or higher, this variable is provided by CMake to report the NDK version number.
loc_cmake_android_process_max: Default value for the ANDROID_PROCESS_MAX target property. See that target property for additional information.
loc_cmake_android_proguard: Default value for the ANDROID_PROGUARD target property. See that target property for additional information.
loc_cmake_android_proguard_config_path: Default value for the ANDROID_PROGUARD_CONFIG_PATH target property. See that target property for additional information.
loc_cmake_android_rtti: When Cross Compiling for Android with the NDK, this variable may be set to specify whether RTTI is enabled.
loc_cmake_android_secure_props_path: Default value for the ANDROID_SECURE_PROPS_PATH target property. See that target property for additional information.
loc_cmake_android_skip_ant_step: Default value for the ANDROID_SKIP_ANT_STEP target property. See that target property for additional information.
loc_cmake_android_standalone_toolchain: When Cross Compiling for Android with a Standalone Toolchain, this variable holds the absolute path to the root directory of the toolchain. The specified directory must contain a sysroot subdirectory.
loc_cmake_android_stl_type: When Cross Compiling for Android with NVIDIA Nsight Tegra Visual Studio Edition, this variable may be set to specify the default value for the ANDROID_STL_TYPE target property. See that target property for additional information.
loc_cmake_appbundle_path: Semicolon-separated list  of directories specifying a search path for macOS application bundles used by the find_program, and find_package commands.
loc_cmake_apple_silicon_processor: On Apple Silicon hosts running macOS, set this variable to tell CMake what architecture to use for CMAKE_HOST_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR. The value must be either arm64 or x86_64.
loc_cmake_ar: Name of archiving tool for static libraries.
loc_cmake_archive_output_directory: Where to put all the ARCHIVE  target files when built.
loc_cmake_archive_output_directory_confi: Where to put all the ARCHIVE  target files when built for a specific configuration.
loc_cmake_argc: Number of command line arguments passed to CMake in script mode.
loc_cmake_argv0: Command line argument passed to CMake in script mode.
loc_cmake_autogen_origin_depends: Switch for forwarding origin target dependencies to the corresponding _autogen targets.
loc_cmake_autogen_parallel: Number of parallel moc or uic processes to start when using AUTOMOC and AUTOUIC.
loc_cmake_autogen_use_system_include: This variable is used to initialize the AUTOGEN_USE_SYSTEM_INCLUDE property on all targets as they are created. See that target property for additional information.
loc_cmake_autogen_verbose: Sets the verbosity of AUTOMOC, AUTOUIC and AUTORCC. A positive integer value or a true boolean value lets the AUTO* generators output additional processing information.
loc_cmake_automoc: Whether to handle moc automatically for Qt targets.
loc_cmake_automoc_compiler_predefines: This variable is used to initialize the AUTOMOC_COMPILER_PREDEFINES property on all the targets. See that target property for additional information.
loc_cmake_automoc_depend_filters: Filter definitions used by CMAKE_AUTOMOC to extract file names from source code as additional dependencies for the moc file.
loc_cmake_automoc_executable: This variable is used to initialize the AUTOMOC_EXECUTABLE property on all the targets. See that target property for additional information.
loc_cmake_automoc_macro_names: Semicolon-separated list  list of macro names used by CMAKE_AUTOMOC to determine if a C++ file needs to be processed by moc.
loc_cmake_automoc_moc_options: Additional options for moc when using CMAKE_AUTOMOC.
loc_cmake_automoc_path_prefix: Whether to generate the -p path prefix option for moc on AUTOMOC enabled Qt targets.
loc_cmake_automoc_relaxed_mode: Switch between strict and relaxed automoc mode.
loc_cmake_autorcc: Whether to handle rcc automatically for Qt targets.
loc_cmake_autorcc_executable: This variable is used to initialize the AUTORCC_EXECUTABLE property on all the targets. See that target property for additional information.
loc_cmake_autorcc_options: Additional options for rcc when using CMAKE_AUTORCC.
loc_cmake_autouic: Whether to handle uic automatically for Qt targets.
loc_cmake_autouic_executable: This variable is used to initialize the AUTOUIC_EXECUTABLE property on all the targets. See that target property for additional information.
loc_cmake_autouic_options: Additional options for uic when using CMAKE_AUTOUIC.
loc_cmake_autouic_search_paths: Search path list used by CMAKE_AUTOUIC to find included .ui files.
loc_cmake_backwards_compatibility: Deprecated. See CMake Policy CMP0001 documentation.
loc_cmake_binary_dir: The path to the top level of the build tree.
loc_cmake_build_rpath: Semicolon-separated list  specifying runtime path (RPATH) entries to add to binaries linked in the build tree (for platforms that support it). The entries will not be used for binaries in the install tree. See also the CMAKE_INSTALL_RPATH variable.
loc_cmake_build_rpath_use_origin: Whether to use relative paths for the build RPATH.
loc_cmake_build_tool: This variable exists only for backwards compatibility. It contains the same value as CMAKE_MAKE_PROGRAM. Use that variable instead.
loc_cmake_build_type: Specifies the build type on single-configuration generators (e.g. Makefile Generators or Ninja). Typical values include Debug, Release, RelWithDebInfo and MinSizeRel, but custom build types can also be defined.
loc_cmake_build_with_install_name_dir: Whether to use INSTALL_NAME_DIR on targets in the build tree.
loc_cmake_build_with_install_rpath: Use the install path for the RPATH.
loc_cmake_cachefile_dir: This variable is used internally by CMake, and may not be set during the first configuration of a build tree. When it is set, it has the same value as CMAKE_BINARY_DIR. Use that variable instead.
loc_cmake_cache_major_version: Major version of CMake used to create the CMakeCache.txt file
loc_cmake_cache_minor_version: Minor version of CMake used to create the CMakeCache.txt file
loc_cmake_cache_patch_version: Patch version of CMake used to create the CMakeCache.txt file
loc_cmake_cfg_intdir: Build-time reference to per-configuration output subdirectory.
loc_cmake_clang_vfs_overlay: When cross compiling for windows with clang-cl, this variable can be an absolute path pointing to a clang virtual file system yaml file, which will enable clang-cl to resolve windows header names on a case sensitive file system.
loc_cmake_codeblocks_compiler_id: Change the compiler id in the generated CodeBlocks project files.
loc_cmake_codeblocks_exclude_external_fi: Change the way the CodeBlocks generator creates project files.
loc_cmake_codelite_use_targets: Change the way the CodeLite generator creates projectfiles.
loc_cmake_color_makefile: Enables color output when using the Makefile Generators.
loc_cmake_command: The full path to the cmake executable.
loc_cmake_compiler_2005: Using the Visual Studio 2005 compiler from Microsoft
loc_cmake_compiler_is_gnucc: True if the C compiler is GNU.
loc_cmake_compiler_is_gnucxx: True if the C++ (CXX) compiler is GNU.
loc_cmake_compiler_is_gnug77: True if the Fortran compiler is GNU.
loc_cmake_compile_pdb_output_directory: Output directory for MS debug symbol .pdb files generated by the compiler while building source files.
loc_cmake_compile_pdb_output_directory_c: Per-configuration output directory for MS debug symbol .pdb files generated by the compiler while building source files.
loc_cmake_compile_warning_as_error: Specify whether to treat warnings on compile as errors.
loc_cmake_configuration_types: Specifies the available build types (configurations) on multi-config generators (e.g. Visual Studio , Xcode, or Ninja Multi-Config) as a semicolon-separated list . Typical entries include Debug, Release, RelWithDebInfo and MinSizeRel, but custom build types can also be defined.
loc_cmake_config_postfix: Default filename postfix for libraries under configuration <CONFIG>.
loc_cmake_cpack_command: Full path to cpack command installed with CMake.
loc_cmake_crosscompiling: This variable is set by CMake to indicate whether it is cross compiling, but note limitations discussed below.
loc_cmake_crosscompiling_emulator: This variable is only used when CMAKE_CROSSCOMPILING is on. It should point to a command on the host system that can run executable built for the target system.
loc_cmake_cross_configs: Specifies a semicolon-separated list  of configurations available from all build-<Config>.ninja files in the Ninja Multi-Config generator. This variable activates cross-config mode. Targets from each config specified in this variable can be built from any build-<Config>.ninja file. Custom commands will use the configuration native to build-<Config>.ninja. If it is set to all, all configurations from CMAKE_CONFIGURATION_TYPES are cross-configs. If it is not specified, or empty, each build-<Config>.ninja file will only contain build rules for its own configuration.
loc_cmake_ctest_arguments: Set this to a semicolon-separated list  of command-line arguments to pass to ctest when running tests through the test (or RUN_TESTS) target of the generated build system.
loc_cmake_ctest_command: Full path to ctest command installed with CMake.
loc_cmake_cuda_architectures: Default value for CUDA_ARCHITECTURES property of targets.
loc_cmake_cuda_compile_features: List of features known to the CUDA compiler
loc_cmake_cuda_extensions: Default value for CUDA_EXTENSIONS target property if set when a target is created.
loc_cmake_cuda_host_compiler: This is the original CUDA-specific name for the more general CMAKE_<LANG>_HOST_COMPILER variable. See the latter for details.
loc_cmake_cuda_resolve_device_symbols: Default value for CUDA_RESOLVE_DEVICE_SYMBOLS target property when defined. By default this variable is not defined.
loc_cmake_cuda_runtime_library: Select the CUDA runtime library for use when compiling and linking CUDA. This variable is used to initialize the CUDA_RUNTIME_LIBRARY property on all targets as they are created.
loc_cmake_cuda_separable_compilation: Default value for CUDA_SEPARABLE_COMPILATION target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created.
loc_cmake_cuda_standard: Default value for CUDA_STANDARD target property if set when a target is created.
loc_cmake_cuda_standard_required: Default value for CUDA_STANDARD_REQUIRED target property if set when a target is created.
loc_cmake_cuda_toolkit_include_directori: When the CUDA language has been enabled, this provides a semicolon-separated list  of include directories provided by the CUDA Toolkit. The value may be useful for C++ source files to include CUDA headers.
loc_cmake_current_binary_dir: The path to the binary directory currently being processed.
loc_cmake_current_function: When executing code inside a function, this variable contains the name of the current function. It can be useful for diagnostic or debug messages.
loc_cmake_current_function_list_dir: When executing code inside a function, this variable contains the full directory of the listfile that defined the current function.
loc_cmake_current_function_list_file: When executing code inside a function, this variable contains the full path to the listfile that defined the current function.
loc_cmake_current_function_list_line: When executing code inside a function, this variable contains the line number in the listfile where the current function was defined.
loc_cmake_current_list_dir: Full directory of the listfile currently being processed.
loc_cmake_current_list_file: Full path to the listfile currently being processed.
loc_cmake_current_list_line: The line number of the current file being processed.
loc_cmake_current_source_dir: The path to the source directory currently being processed.
loc_cmake_cxx_compile_features: List of features known to the C++ compiler
loc_cmake_cxx_extensions: Default value for CXX_EXTENSIONS target property if set when a target is created.
loc_cmake_cxx_scan_for_modules: Whether to scan C++ source files for module dependencies.
loc_cmake_cxx_standard: Default value for CXX_STANDARD target property if set when a target is created.
loc_cmake_cxx_standard_required: Default value for CXX_STANDARD_REQUIRED target property if set when a target is created.
loc_cmake_c_compile_features: List of features known to the C compiler
loc_cmake_c_extensions: Default value for C_EXTENSIONS target property if set when a target is created.
loc_cmake_c_standard: Default value for C_STANDARD target property if set when a target is created.
loc_cmake_c_standard_required: Default value for C_STANDARD_REQUIRED target property if set when a target is created.
loc_cmake_debug_target_properties: Enables tracing output for target properties.
loc_cmake_default_build_type: Specifies the configuration to use by default in a build.ninja file in the Ninja Multi-Config generator. If this variable is specified, build.ninja uses build rules from build-<Config>.ninja by default. All custom commands are executed with this configuration. If the variable is not specified, the first item from CMAKE_CONFIGURATION_TYPES is used instead.
loc_cmake_default_configs: Specifies a semicolon-separated list  of configurations to build for a target in build.ninja if no :<Config> suffix is specified in the Ninja Multi-Config generator. If it is set to all, all configurations from CMAKE_CROSS_CONFIGS are used. If it is not specified, it defaults to CMAKE_DEFAULT_BUILD_TYPE.
loc_cmake_depends_in_project_only: When set to TRUE in a directory, the build system produced by the Makefile Generators is set up to only consider dependencies on source files that appear either in the source or in the binary directories. Changes to source files outside of these directories will not cause rebuilds.
loc_cmake_depends_use_compiler: For the Makefile Generators, source dependencies are now, for a selection of compilers, generated by the compiler itself. By defining this variable with value FALSE, you can restore the legacy behavior (i.e. using CMake for dependencies discovery).
loc_cmake_directory_labels: Specify labels for the current directory.
loc_cmake_disable_precompile_headers: Default value for DISABLE_PRECOMPILE_HEADERS of targets.
loc_cmake_dll_name_with_soversion: This variable is used to initialize the DLL_NAME_WITH_SOVERSION property on shared library targets for the Windows platform, which is selected when the WIN32 variable is set.
loc_cmake_dl_libs: Name of library containing dlopen and dlclose.
loc_cmake_dotnet_sdk: Default value for DOTNET_SDK property of targets.
loc_cmake_dotnet_target_framework: Default value for DOTNET_TARGET_FRAMEWORK property of targets.
loc_cmake_dotnet_target_framework_versio: Default value for DOTNET_TARGET_FRAMEWORK_VERSION property of targets.
loc_cmake_eclipse_generate_linked_resour: This cache variable is used by the Eclipse project generator. See cmake-generators.
loc_cmake_eclipse_generate_source_projec: This cache variable is used by the Eclipse project generator. See cmake-generators.
loc_cmake_eclipse_make_arguments: This cache variable is used by the Eclipse project generator. See cmake-generators.
loc_cmake_eclipse_resource_encoding: This cache variable tells the Eclipse CDT4 project generator to set the resource encoding to the given value in generated project files. If no value is given, no encoding will be set.
loc_cmake_eclipse_version: This cache variable is used by the Eclipse project generator. See cmake-generators.
loc_cmake_edit_command: Full path to cmake-gui or ccmake. Defined only for Makefile Generators and Ninja Generators when not using any Extra Generators.
loc_cmake_enable_exports: Specify whether executables export symbols for loadable modules.
loc_cmake_error_deprecated: Whether to issue errors for deprecated functionality.
loc_cmake_error_on_absolute_install_dest: Ask cmake_install.cmake script to error out as soon as a file with absolute INSTALL DESTINATION is encountered.
loc_cmake_executable_enable_exports: Specify whether executables export symbols for loadable modules.
loc_cmake_executable_suffix: The suffix for executables on this platform.
loc_cmake_executable_suffix_lang: The suffix to use for the end of an executable filename of <LANG> compiler target architecture, if any.
loc_cmake_execute_process_command_echo: If this variable is set to STDERR, STDOUT or NONE then commands in execute_process calls will be printed to either stderr or stdout or not at all.
loc_cmake_exe_linker_flags: Linker flags to be used to create executables.
loc_cmake_exe_linker_flags_config: Flags to be used when linking an executable.
loc_cmake_exe_linker_flags_config_init: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS_ cache entry the first time a build tree is configured. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file . CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.
loc_cmake_exe_linker_flags_init: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS cache entry the first time a build tree is configured. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file . CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.
loc_cmake_export_compile_commands: Enable/Disable output of compile commands during generation.
loc_cmake_export_no_package_registry: Disable the export command when CMP0090 is not set to NEW.
loc_cmake_export_package_registry: Enables the export command when CMP0090 is set to NEW.
loc_cmake_extra_generator: The extra generator used to build the project. See cmake-generators.
loc_cmake_find_appbundle: This variable affects how find_* commands choose between macOS Application Bundles and unix-style package components.
loc_cmake_find_debug_mode: Print extra find call information for the following commands to standard error:
loc_cmake_find_framework: This variable affects how find_* commands choose between macOS Frameworks and unix-style package components.
loc_cmake_find_library_custom_lib_suffix: Specify a <suffix> to tell the find_library command to search in a lib<suffix> directory before each lib directory that would normally be searched.
loc_cmake_find_library_prefixes: Prefixes to prepend when looking for libraries.
loc_cmake_find_library_suffixes: Suffixes to append when looking for libraries.
loc_cmake_find_no_install_prefix: Exclude the values of the CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX and CMAKE_STAGING_PREFIX variables from CMAKE_SYSTEM_PREFIX_PATH. CMake adds these project-destination prefixes to CMAKE_SYSTEM_PREFIX_PATH by default in order to support building a series of dependent packages and installing them into a common prefix. Set CMAKE_FIND_NO_INSTALL_PREFIX to TRUE to suppress this behavior.
loc_cmake_find_package_name: Defined by the find_package command while loading a find module to record the caller-specified package name. See command documentation for details.
loc_cmake_find_package_no_package_regist: By default this variable is not set. If neither CMAKE_FIND_USE_PACKAGE_REGISTRY nor CMAKE_FIND_PACKAGE_NO_PACKAGE_REGISTRY is set, then find_package() will use the User Package Registry unless the NO_CMAKE_PACKAGE_REGISTRY option is provided.
loc_cmake_find_package_no_system_package: By default this variable is not set. If neither CMAKE_FIND_USE_SYSTEM_PACKAGE_REGISTRY nor CMAKE_FIND_PACKAGE_NO_SYSTEM_PACKAGE_REGISTRY is set, then find_package() will use the System Package Registry unless the NO_CMAKE_SYSTEM_PACKAGE_REGISTRY option is provided.
loc_cmake_find_package_prefer_config: Tell find_package to try "Config" mode before "Module" mode if no mode was specified.
loc_cmake_find_package_redirects_dir: This read-only variable specifies a directory that the find_package command will check first before searching anywhere else for a module or config package file. A config package file in this directory will always be found in preference to any other Find module file or config package file.
loc_cmake_find_package_resolve_symlinks: Set to TRUE to tell find_package calls to resolve symbolic links in the value of <PackageName>_DIR.
loc_cmake_find_package_sort_direction: The sorting direction used by CMAKE_FIND_PACKAGE_SORT_ORDER. It can assume one of the following values:
loc_cmake_find_package_sort_order: The default order for sorting packages found using find_package. It can assume one of the following values:
loc_cmake_find_package_targets_global: Setting to TRUE promotes all IMPORTED targets discoverd by find_package to a GLOBAL scope.
loc_cmake_find_package_warn_no_module: Tell find_package to warn if called without an explicit mode.
loc_cmake_find_root_path: Semicolon-separated list  of root paths to search on the filesystem.
loc_cmake_find_root_path_mode_include: This variable controls whether the CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH and CMAKE_SYSROOT are used by FIND_XXX.
loc_cmake_find_root_path_mode_library: This variable controls whether the CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH and CMAKE_SYSROOT are used by FIND_XXX.
loc_cmake_find_root_path_mode_package: This variable controls whether the CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH and CMAKE_SYSROOT are used by FIND_XXX.
loc_cmake_find_root_path_mode_program: This variable controls whether the CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH and CMAKE_SYSROOT are used by FIND_XXX.
loc_cmake_find_use_cmake_environment_pat: Controls the default behavior of the following commands for whether or not to search paths provided by cmake-specific environment variables:
loc_cmake_find_use_cmake_path: Controls the default behavior of the following commands for whether or not to search paths provided by cmake-specific cache variables:
loc_cmake_find_use_cmake_system_path: Controls the default behavior of the following commands for whether or not to search paths provided by platform-specific cmake variables:
loc_cmake_find_use_install_prefix: Controls the default behavior of the following commands for whether or not to search the locations in the CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX and CMAKE_STAGING_PREFIX variables.
loc_cmake_find_use_package_registry: Controls the default behavior of the find_package command for whether or not to search paths provided by the User Package Registry.
loc_cmake_find_use_package_root_path: Controls the default behavior of the following commands for whether or not to search paths provided by <PackageName>_ROOT variables:
loc_cmake_find_use_system_environment_pa: Controls the default behavior of the following commands for whether or not to search paths provided by standard system environment variables:
loc_cmake_find_use_system_package_regist: Controls searching the System Package Registry by the find_package command.
loc_cmake_folder: Set the folder name. Use to organize targets in an IDE.
loc_cmake_fortran_format: Set to FIXED or FREE to indicate the Fortran source layout.
loc_cmake_fortran_moddir_flag: Fortran flag for module output directory.
loc_cmake_fortran_modout_flag: Fortran flag to enable module output.
loc_cmake_fortran_preprocess: Default value for Fortran_PREPROCESS of targets.
loc_cmake_framework: Default value for FRAMEWORK of targets.
loc_cmake_framework_multi_config_postfix: Default framework filename postfix under configuration <CONFIG> when using a multi-config generator.
loc_cmake_framework_path: Semicolon-separated list  of directories specifying a search path for macOS frameworks used by the find_library, find_package, find_path, and find_file commands.
loc_cmake_generator: The generator used to build the project. See cmake-generators.
loc_cmake_generator_instance: Generator-specific instance specification provided by user.
loc_cmake_generator_platform: Generator-specific target platform specification provided by user.
loc_cmake_generator_toolset: Native build system toolset specification provided by user.
loc_cmake_ghs_no_source_group_file: ON / OFF boolean to control if the project file for a target should be one single file or multiple files. Refer to GHS_NO_SOURCE_GROUP_FILE for further details.
loc_cmake_global_autogen_target: Switch to enable generation of a global autogen target.
loc_cmake_global_autogen_target_name: Change the name of the global autogen target.
loc_cmake_global_autorcc_target: Switch to enable generation of a global autorcc target.
loc_cmake_global_autorcc_target_name: Change the name of the global autorcc target.
loc_cmake_gnutoms: Convert GNU import libraries (.dll.a) to MS format (.lib).
loc_cmake_hip_architectures: List of GPU architectures to for which to generate device code. Architecture names are interpreted based on CMAKE_HIP_PLATFORM.
loc_cmake_hip_extensions: Default value for HIP_EXTENSIONS target property if set when a target is created.
loc_cmake_hip_platform: GPU platform for which HIP language sources are to be compiled.
loc_cmake_hip_standard: Default value for HIP_STANDARD target property if set when a target is created.
loc_cmake_hip_standard_required: Default value for HIP_STANDARD_REQUIRED target property if set when a target is created.
loc_cmake_home_directory: Path to top of source tree. Same as CMAKE_SOURCE_DIR.
loc_cmake_host_apple: True for Apple macOS operating systems.
loc_cmake_host_bsd: Set to a string value when the host system is BSD. This value can be one of the following: DragonFlyBSD, FreeBSD, OpenBSD, or NetBSD.
loc_cmake_host_linux: Set to true when the host system is Linux.
loc_cmake_host_solaris: True for Oracle Solaris operating systems.
loc_cmake_host_system: Composite Name of OS CMake is being run on.
loc_cmake_host_system_name: Name of the OS CMake is running on.
loc_cmake_host_system_processor: The name of the CPU CMake is running on.
loc_cmake_host_system_version: The OS version CMake is running on.
loc_cmake_host_unix: True for UNIX and UNIX like operating systems.
loc_cmake_host_win32: True if the host system is running Windows, including Windows 64-bit and MSYS.
loc_cmake_ignore_path: Semicolon-separated list  of directories to be ignored by the various find...() commands.
loc_cmake_ignore_prefix_path: Semicolon-separated list  of search prefixes to be ignored by the find_program, find_library, find_file, and find_path commands. The prefixes are also ignored by the Config mode of the find_package command (Module mode is unaffected). To ignore specific directories instead, see CMAKE_IGNORE_NONPREFIX_VAR.
loc_cmake_import_library_prefix: The prefix for import libraries that you link to.
loc_cmake_import_library_suffix: The suffix for import libraries that you link to.
loc_cmake_include_current_dir: Automatically add the current source and build directories to the include path.
loc_cmake_include_current_dir_in_interfa: Automatically add the current source and build directories to the INTERFACE_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES target property.
loc_cmake_include_directories_before: Whether to append or prepend directories by default in include_directories.
loc_cmake_include_directories_project_be: Whether to force prepending of project include directories.
loc_cmake_include_path: Semicolon-separated list  of directories specifying a search path for the find_file and find_path commands. By default it is empty, it is intended to be set by the project.
loc_cmake_install_default_component_name: Default component used in install commands.
loc_cmake_install_default_directory_perm: Default permissions for directories created implicitly during installation of files by install and file.
loc_cmake_install_message: Specify verbosity of installation script code generated by the install command (using the file command). For paths that are newly installed or updated, installation may print lines like:
loc_cmake_install_name_dir: Directory name for installed targets on Apple platforms.
loc_cmake_install_prefix_initialized_to_: CMake sets this variable to a TRUE value when the CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX has just been initialized to its default value, typically on the first run of CMake within a new build tree. This can be used by project code to change the default without overriding a user-provided value:
loc_cmake_install_remove_environment_rpa: Sets the default for whether toolchain-defined rpaths should be removed during installation.
loc_cmake_install_rpath: The rpath to use for installed targets.
loc_cmake_install_rpath_use_link_path: Add paths to linker search and installed rpath.
loc_cmake_internal_platform_abi: An internal variable subject to change.
loc_cmake_interprocedural_optimization: Default value for INTERPROCEDURAL_OPTIMIZATION of targets.
loc_cmake_interprocedural_optimization_c: Default value for INTERPROCEDURAL_OPTIMIZATION_ of targets.
loc_cmake_ios_install_combined: Default value for IOS_INSTALL_COMBINED of targets.
loc_cmake_ispc_header_suffix: Output suffix to be used for ISPC generated headers.
loc_cmake_ispc_instruction_sets: Default value for ISPC_INSTRUCTION_SETS property of targets.
loc_cmake_job_pools: If the JOB_POOLS global property is not set, the value of this variable is used in its place. See JOB_POOLS for additional information.
loc_cmake_job_pool_compile: This variable is used to initialize the JOB_POOL_COMPILE property on all the targets. See JOB_POOL_COMPILE for additional information.
loc_cmake_job_pool_link: This variable is used to initialize the JOB_POOL_LINK property on all the targets. See JOB_POOL_LINK for additional information.
loc_cmake_job_pool_precompile_header: This variable is used to initialize the JOB_POOL_PRECOMPILE_HEADER property on all the targets. See JOB_POOL_PRECOMPILE_HEADER for additional information.
loc_cmake_kate_files_mode: This cache variable is used by the Kate project generator and controls to what mode the files entry in the project file will be set. See cmake-generators.
loc_cmake_kate_make_arguments: This cache variable is used by the Kate project generator. See cmake-generators.
loc_cmake_lang_android_toolchain_machine: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the toolchain binutils machine name (e.g. gcc -dumpmachine). The binutils typically have a <machine>- prefix on their name.
loc_cmake_lang_android_toolchain_prefix: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the absolute path prefixing the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.
loc_cmake_lang_android_toolchain_suffix: When Cross Compiling for Android this variable contains the host platform suffix of the toolchain GNU compiler and its binutils.
loc_cmake_lang_archive_append: Rule variable to append to a static archive.
loc_cmake_lang_archive_create: Rule variable to create a new static archive.
loc_cmake_lang_archive_finish: Rule variable to finish an existing static archive.
loc_cmake_lang_byte_order: Byte order of <LANG> compiler target architecture, if known. If defined and not empty, the value is one of:
loc_cmake_lang_clang_tidy: Default value for <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY target property when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.
loc_cmake_lang_clang_tidy_export_fixes_d: Default value for <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY_EXPORT_FIXES_DIR target property when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.
loc_cmake_lang_compiler: The full path to the compiler for LANG.
loc_cmake_lang_compiler_abi: An internal variable subject to change.
loc_cmake_lang_compiler_ar: A wrapper around ar adding the appropriate --plugin option for the compiler.
loc_cmake_lang_compiler_architecture_id: An internal variable subject to change.
loc_cmake_lang_compiler_external_toolcha: The external toolchain for cross-compiling, if supported.
loc_cmake_lang_compiler_frontend_variant: Identification string of the compiler frontend variant.
loc_cmake_lang_compiler_launcher: Default value for <LANG>_COMPILER_LAUNCHER target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C, CXX, Fortran, HIP, ISPC, OBJC, OBJCXX, or CUDA.
loc_cmake_lang_compiler_loaded: Defined to true if the language is enabled.
loc_cmake_lang_compiler_predefines_comma: Command that outputs the compiler pre definitions.
loc_cmake_lang_compiler_ranlib: A wrapper around ranlib adding the appropriate --plugin option for the compiler.
loc_cmake_lang_compiler_target: The target for cross-compiling, if supported.
loc_cmake_lang_compiler_version_internal: An internal variable subject to change.
loc_cmake_lang_compile_object: Rule variable to compile a single object file.
loc_cmake_lang_cppcheck: Default value for <LANG>_CPPCHECK target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.
loc_cmake_lang_cpplint: Default value for <LANG>_CPPLINT target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.
loc_cmake_lang_create_shared_library: Rule variable to create a shared library.
loc_cmake_lang_create_shared_module: Rule variable to create a shared module.
loc_cmake_lang_create_static_library: Rule variable to create a static library.
loc_cmake_lang_extensions_default: Compiler's default extensions mode. Used as the default for the <LANG>_EXTENSIONS target property when CMAKE_<LANG>_EXTENSIONS is not set (see CMP0128).
loc_cmake_lang_flags: Language-wide flags for language <LANG> used when building for all configurations. These flags will be passed to all invocations of the compiler. This includes invocations that drive compiling and those that drive linking.
loc_cmake_lang_flags_config: Language-wide flags for language <LANG> used when building for the <CONFIG> configuration. These flags will be passed to all invocations of the compiler in the corresponding configuration. This includes invocations that drive compiling and those that drive linking.
loc_cmake_lang_flags_config_init: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_ cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file . CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.
loc_cmake_lang_flags_debug: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_ variable.
loc_cmake_lang_flags_debug_init: This variable is the Debug variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.
loc_cmake_lang_flags_init: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS cache entry the first time a build tree is configured for language <LANG>. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file . CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform. For example, the contents of a xxxFLAGS environment variable will be prepended, where xxx will be language-specific but not necessarily the same as <LANG> (e.g. CXXFLAGS for CXX, FFLAGS for Fortran, and so on). This value is a command-line string fragment. Therefore, multiple options should be separated by spaces, and options with spaces should be quoted.
loc_cmake_lang_flags_minsizerel: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_ variable.
loc_cmake_lang_flags_minsizerel_init: This variable is the MinSizeRel variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.
loc_cmake_lang_flags_release: This variable is the Release variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_ variable.
loc_cmake_lang_flags_release_init: This variable is the Release variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.
loc_cmake_lang_flags_relwithdebinfo: This variable is the RelWithDebInfo variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_ variable.
loc_cmake_lang_flags_relwithdebinfo_init: This variable is the RelWithDebInfo variant of the CMAKE_<LANG>_FLAGS_<CONFIG>_INIT variable.
loc_cmake_lang_host_compiler: This variable is available when <LANG> is CUDA or HIP.
loc_cmake_lang_ignore_extensions: File extensions that should be ignored by the build.
loc_cmake_lang_implicit_include_director: Directories implicitly searched by the compiler for header files.
loc_cmake_lang_implicit_link_directories: Implicit linker search path detected for language <LANG>.
loc_cmake_lang_implicit_link_framework_d: Implicit linker framework search path detected for language <LANG>.
loc_cmake_lang_implicit_link_libraries: Implicit link libraries and flags detected for language <LANG>.
loc_cmake_lang_include_what_you_use: Default value for <LANG>_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C or CXX.
loc_cmake_lang_library_architecture: Target architecture library directory name detected for <LANG>.
loc_cmake_lang_linker_launcher: Default value for <LANG>_LINKER_LAUNCHER target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created. This is done only when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC, or OBJCXX.
loc_cmake_lang_linker_preference: An internal variable subject to change.
loc_cmake_lang_linker_preference_propaga: An internal variable subject to change.
loc_cmake_lang_linker_wrapper_flag: Defines the syntax of compiler driver option to pass options to the linker tool. It will be used to translate the LINKER: prefix in the link options (see add_link_options and target_link_options).
loc_cmake_lang_linker_wrapper_flag_sep: This variable is used with CMAKE_<LANG>_LINKER_WRAPPER_FLAG variable to format LINKER: prefix in the link options (see add_link_options and target_link_options).
loc_cmake_lang_link_executable: Rule variable to link an executable.
loc_cmake_lang_link_group_using_feature: This variable defines how to link a group of libraries for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_GROUP generator expression is used and the link language for the target is <LANG>. For this variable to have any effect, the associated CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED variable must be set to true.
loc_cmake_lang_link_group_using_feature_: This variable specifies whether the <FEATURE> is supported for the link language <LANG>. If this variable is true, then the <FEATURE> must be defined by CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_GROUP_USING_, and the more generic CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED and CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_ variables are not used.
loc_cmake_lang_link_library_file_flag: Language-specific flag to be used to link a library specified by a path to its file.
loc_cmake_lang_link_library_flag: Flag to be used to link a library into a shared library or executable.
loc_cmake_lang_link_library_suffix: Language-specific suffix for libraries that you link to.
loc_cmake_lang_link_library_using_featur: This variable defines how to link a library or framework for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_LIBRARY generator expression is used and the link language for the target is <LANG>. For this variable to have any effect, the associated CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_<FEATURE>_SUPPORTED variable must be set to true.
Set to TRUE if the <FEATURE>, as defined by variable CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_, is supported for the linker language <LANG>.
loc_cmake_lang_link_what_you_use_flag: Linker flag to be used to configure linker so that all specified libraries on the command line will be linked into the target.
loc_cmake_lang_output_extension: Extension for the output of a compile for a single file.
loc_cmake_lang_platform_id: An internal variable subject to change.
loc_cmake_lang_sizeof_data_ptr: Size of pointer-to-data types for language <LANG>.
loc_cmake_lang_source_file_extensions: Extensions of source files for the given language.
loc_cmake_lang_standard_default: The compiler's default standard for the language <LANG>. Empty if the compiler has no conception of standard levels.
loc_cmake_lang_standard_include_director: Include directories to be used for every source file compiled with the <LANG> compiler. This is meant for specification of system include directories needed by the language for the current platform. The directories always appear at the end of the include path passed to the compiler.
loc_cmake_lang_standard_libraries: Libraries linked into every executable and shared library linked for language <LANG>. This is meant for specification of system libraries needed by the language for the current platform.
loc_cmake_lang_visibility_preset: Default value for the <LANG>_VISIBILITY_PRESET target property when a target is created.
loc_cmake_library_architecture: Target architecture library directory name, if detected.
loc_cmake_library_architecture_regex: Regex matching possible target architecture library directory names.
loc_cmake_library_output_directory: Where to put all the LIBRARY  target files when built.
loc_cmake_library_output_directory_confi: Where to put all the LIBRARY  target files when built for a specific configuration.
loc_cmake_library_path: Semicolon-separated list  of directories specifying a search path for the find_library command. By default it is empty, it is intended to be set by the project.
loc_cmake_library_path_flag: The flag to be used to add a library search path to a compiler.
loc_cmake_link_def_file_flag: Linker flag to be used to specify a .def file for dll creation.
loc_cmake_link_depends_no_shared: Whether to skip link dependencies on shared library files.
loc_cmake_link_depends_use_linker: For the Makefile  and Ninja  generators, link dependencies are now, for a selection of linkers, generated by the linker itself. By defining this variable with value FALSE, you can deactivate this feature.
loc_cmake_link_directories_before: Whether to append or prepend directories by default in link_directories.
loc_cmake_link_group_using_feature: This variable defines how to link a group of libraries for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_GROUP generator expression is used. Both of the following conditions must be met for this variable to have any effect:
loc_cmake_link_group_using_feature_suppo: This variable specifies whether the <FEATURE> is supported regardless of the link language. If this variable is true, then the <FEATURE> must be defined by CMAKE_LINK_GROUP_USING_.
loc_cmake_link_interface_libraries: Default value for LINK_INTERFACE_LIBRARIES of targets.
loc_cmake_link_libraries_only_targets: Set this variable to initialize the LINK_LIBRARIES_ONLY_TARGETS property of non-imported targets when they are created. Setting it to true enables an additional check that all items named by target_link_libraries that can be target names are actually names of existing targets. See the target property documentation for details.
loc_cmake_link_library_file_flag: Flag to be used to link a library specified by a path to its file.
loc_cmake_link_library_flag: Flag to be used to link a library into an executable.
loc_cmake_link_library_suffix: The suffix for libraries that you link to.
loc_cmake_link_library_using_feature: This variable defines how to link a library or framework for the specified <FEATURE> when a LINK_LIBRARY generator expression is used. Both of the following conditions must be met for this variable to have any effect:
loc_cmake_link_library_using_feature_sup: Set to TRUE if the <FEATURE>, as defined by variable CMAKE_LINK_LIBRARY_USING_, is supported regardless the linker language.
loc_cmake_link_search_end_static: End a link line such that static system libraries are used.
loc_cmake_link_search_start_static: Assume the linker looks for static libraries by default.
loc_cmake_link_what_you_use: Default value for LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created.
loc_cmake_link_what_you_use_check: Defines the command executed after the link step to check libraries usage. This check is currently only defined on ELF platforms with value ldd -u -r.
loc_cmake_macosx_bundle: Default value for MACOSX_BUNDLE of targets.
loc_cmake_macosx_rpath: Whether to use rpaths on macOS and iOS.
loc_cmake_major_version: First version number component of the CMAKE_VERSION variable.
loc_cmake_make_program: Tool that can launch the native build system. The value may be the full path to an executable or just the tool name if it is expected to be in the PATH.
loc_cmake_map_imported_config_config: Default value for MAP_IMPORTED_CONFIG_ of targets.
loc_cmake_match_count: The number of matches with the last regular expression.
loc_cmake_match_n: Capture group <n> matched by the last regular expression, for groups 0 through 9. Group 0 is the entire match. Groups 1 through 9 are the subexpressions captured by () syntax.
loc_cmake_maximum_recursion_depth: Maximum recursion depth for CMake scripts. It is intended to be set on the command line with -DCMAKE_MAXIMUM_RECURSION_DEPTH=<x>, or within CMakeLists.txt by projects that require a large recursion depth. Projects that set this variable should provide the user with a way to override it. For example:
loc_cmake_message_context: When enabled by the cmake --log-context command line option or the CMAKE_MESSAGE_CONTEXT_SHOW variable, the message command converts the CMAKE_MESSAGE_CONTEXT list into a dot-separated string surrounded by square brackets and prepends it to each line for messages of log levels NOTICE and below.
loc_cmake_message_context_show: Setting this variable to true enables showing a context with each line logged by the message command (see CMAKE_MESSAGE_CONTEXT for how the context itself is specified).
loc_cmake_message_indent: The message command joins the strings from this list and for log levels of NOTICE and below, it prepends the resultant string to each line of the message.
loc_cmake_message_log_level: When set, this variable specifies the logging level used by the message command. Valid values are the same as those for the --log-level <cmake --log-level> command line option of the cmake program. If this variable is set and the --log-level <cmake --log-level> command line option is given, the command line option takes precedence.
loc_cmake_mfc_flag: Use the MFC library for an executable or dll.
loc_cmake_minimum_required_version: The <min> version of CMake given to the most recent call to the cmake_minimum_required command in the current variable scope or any parent variable scope.
loc_cmake_minor_version: Second version number component of the CMAKE_VERSION variable.
loc_cmake_module_linker_flags: Linker flags to be used to create modules.
loc_cmake_module_linker_flags_config: Flags to be used when linking a module.
loc_cmake_module_linker_flags_config_ini: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_MODULE_LINKER_FLAGS_ cache entry the first time a build tree is configured. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file . CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.
loc_cmake_module_linker_flags_init: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_MODULE_LINKER_FLAGS cache entry the first time a build tree is configured. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file . CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.
loc_cmake_module_path: Semicolon-separated list  of directories, represented using forward slashes, specifying a search path for CMake modules to be loaded by the include or find_package commands before checking the default modules that come with CMake. By default it is empty. It is intended to be set by the project.
loc_cmake_msvcide_run_path: Extra PATH locations that should be used when executing add_custom_command or add_custom_target when using the Visual Studio 9 2008 (or above) generator. This allows for running commands and using dll's that the IDE environment is not aware of.
loc_cmake_msvc_debug_information_format: Select the MSVC debug information format targeting the MSVC ABI. This variable is used to initialize the MSVC_DEBUG_INFORMATION_FORMAT property on all targets as they are created. It is also propagated by calls to the try_compile command into the test project.
loc_cmake_msvc_runtime_library: Select the MSVC runtime library for use by compilers targeting the MSVC ABI. This variable is used to initialize the MSVC_RUNTIME_LIBRARY property on all targets as they are created. It is also propagated by calls to the try_compile command into the test project.
loc_cmake_netrc: This variable is used to initialize the NETRC option for the file and file commands. See those commands for additional information.
loc_cmake_netrc_file: This variable is used to initialize the NETRC_FILE option for the file and file commands. See those commands for additional information.
loc_cmake_ninja_output_path_prefix: Tell the Ninja Generators to add a prefix to every output path in build.ninja. A trailing slash is appended to the prefix, if missing.
loc_cmake_no_builtin_chrpath: Do not use the builtin binary editor to fix runtime library search paths on installation.
loc_cmake_no_system_from_imported: Default value for NO_SYSTEM_FROM_IMPORTED of targets.
loc_cmake_objcxx_extensions: Default value for OBJCXX_EXTENSIONS target property if set when a target is created.
loc_cmake_objcxx_standard: Default value for OBJCXX_STANDARD target property if set when a target is created.
loc_cmake_objcxx_standard_required: Default value for OBJCXX_STANDARD_REQUIRED target property if set when a target is created.
loc_cmake_objc_extensions: Default value for OBJC_EXTENSIONS target property if set when a target is created.
loc_cmake_objc_standard: Default value for OBJC_STANDARD target property if set when a target is created.
loc_cmake_objc_standard_required: Default value for OBJC_STANDARD_REQUIRED target property if set when a target is created.
loc_cmake_object_path_max: Maximum object file full-path length allowed by native build tools.
loc_cmake_osx_architectures: Target specific architectures for macOS and iOS.
loc_cmake_osx_deployment_target: Specify the minimum version of the target platform (e.g. macOS or iOS) on which the target binaries are to be deployed. CMake uses this variable value for the -mmacosx-version-min flag or their respective target platform equivalents. For older Xcode versions that shipped multiple macOS SDKs this variable also helps to choose the SDK in case CMAKE_OSX_SYSROOT is unset.
loc_cmake_osx_sysroot: Specify the location or name of the macOS platform SDK to be used. CMake uses this value to compute the value of the -isysroot flag or equivalent and to help the find_* commands locate files in the SDK.
loc_cmake_parent_list_file: Full path to the CMake file that included the current one.
loc_cmake_patch_version: Third version number component of the CMAKE_VERSION variable.
loc_cmake_pch_instantiate_templates: This variable is used to initialize the PCH_INSTANTIATE_TEMPLATES property of targets when they are created.
loc_cmake_pch_warn_invalid: This variable is used to initialize the PCH_WARN_INVALID property of targets when they are created.
loc_cmake_pdb_output_directory: Output directory for MS debug symbol .pdb files generated by the linker for executable and shared library targets.
loc_cmake_pdb_output_directory_config: Per-configuration output directory for MS debug symbol .pdb files generated by the linker for executable and shared library targets.
loc_cmake_platform_no_versioned_soname: This variable is used to globally control whether the VERSION and SOVERSION target properties should be used for shared libraries. When set to true, adding version information to each shared library target is disabled.
loc_cmake_policy_default_cmpnnnn: Default for CMake Policy CMP<NNNN> when it is otherwise left unset.
loc_cmake_policy_warning_cmpnnnn: Explicitly enable or disable the warning when CMake Policy CMP<NNNN> has not been set explicitly by cmake_policy or implicitly by cmake_minimum_required. This is meaningful only for the policies that do not warn by default:
loc_cmake_position_independent_code: Default value for POSITION_INDEPENDENT_CODE of targets.
loc_cmake_prefix_path: Semicolon-separated list  of directories specifying installation prefixes to be searched by the find_package, find_program, find_library, find_file, and find_path commands. Each command will add appropriate subdirectories (like bin, lib, or include) as specified in its own documentation.
loc_cmake_program_path: Semicolon-separated list  of directories specifying a search path for the find_program command. By default it is empty, it is intended to be set by the project.
loc_cmake_project_description: The description of the top level project.
loc_cmake_project_homepage_url: The homepage URL of the top level project.
loc_cmake_project_include: A CMake language file or module to be included as the last step of all project command calls. This is intended for injecting custom code into project builds without modifying their source. See Code Injection for a more detailed discussion of files potentially included during a project call.
loc_cmake_project_include_before: A CMake language file or module to be included as the first step of all project command calls. This is intended for injecting custom code into project builds without modifying their source. See Code Injection for a more detailed discussion of files potentially included during a project call.
loc_cmake_project_name: The name of the top level project.
loc_cmake_project_projectname_include: A CMake language file or module to be included as the last step of any project command calls that specify <PROJECT-NAME> as the project name. This is intended for injecting custom code into project builds without modifying their source. See Code Injection for a more detailed discussion of files potentially included during a project call.
loc_cmake_project_projectname_include_be: A CMake language file or module to be included as the first step of any project command calls that specify <PROJECT-NAME> as the project name. This is intended for injecting custom code into project builds without modifying their source. See Code Injection for a more detailed discussion of files potentially included during a project call.
loc_cmake_project_top_level_includes: Semicolon-separated list  of CMake language files to include as part of the very first project call. The files will be included immediately after the toolchain file has been read (if one is specified) and platform variables have been set, but before any languages have been enabled. Therefore, language-specific variables, including things like CMAKE_<LANG>_COMPILER, might not be set. See Code Injection for a more detailed discussion of files potentially included during a project call.
loc_cmake_project_version: The version of the top level project.
loc_cmake_project_version_major: The major version of the top level project.
loc_cmake_project_version_minor: The minor version of the top level project.
loc_cmake_project_version_patch: The patch version of the top level project.
loc_cmake_project_version_tweak: The tweak version of the top level project.
loc_cmake_ranlib: Name of randomizing tool for static libraries.
loc_cmake_require_find_package_packagena: Variable for making find_package call REQUIRED.
loc_cmake_rule_messages: Specify whether to report a message for each make rule.
loc_cmake_runtime_output_directory: Where to put all the RUNTIME  target files when built.
loc_cmake_runtime_output_directory_confi: Where to put all the RUNTIME  target files when built for a specific configuration.
loc_cmake_script_mode_file: Full path to the cmake -P script file currently being processed.
loc_cmake_shared_library_enable_exports: Specify whether shared library generates an import file.
loc_cmake_shared_library_prefix: The prefix for shared libraries that you link to.
loc_cmake_shared_library_suffix: The suffix for shared libraries that you link to.
loc_cmake_shared_linker_flags: Linker flags to be used to create shared libraries.
loc_cmake_shared_linker_flags_config: Flags to be used when linking a shared library.
loc_cmake_shared_linker_flags_config_ini: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_SHARED_LINKER_FLAGS_ cache entry the first time a build tree is configured. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file . CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.
loc_cmake_shared_linker_flags_init: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_SHARED_LINKER_FLAGS cache entry the first time a build tree is configured. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file . CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.
loc_cmake_shared_module_prefix: The prefix for loadable modules that you link to.
loc_cmake_shared_module_suffix: The suffix for shared libraries that you link to.
loc_cmake_skip_build_rpath: Do not include RPATHs in the build tree.
loc_cmake_skip_install_all_dependency: Don't make the install target depend on the all target.
loc_cmake_skip_install_rpath: Do not include RPATHs in the install tree.
loc_cmake_skip_install_rules: Whether to disable generation of installation rules.
loc_cmake_skip_rpath: If true, do not add run time path information.
loc_cmake_source_dir: The path to the top level of the source tree.
loc_cmake_staging_prefix: This variable may be set to a path to install to when cross-compiling. This can be useful if the path in CMAKE_SYSROOT is read-only, or otherwise should remain pristine.
loc_cmake_static_library_prefix: The prefix for static libraries that you link to.
loc_cmake_static_library_suffix: The suffix for static libraries that you link to.
loc_cmake_static_linker_flags: Flags to be used to create static libraries. These flags will be passed to the archiver when creating a static library.
loc_cmake_static_linker_flags_config: Flags to be used to create static libraries. These flags will be passed to the archiver when creating a static library in the <CONFIG> configuration.
loc_cmake_static_linker_flags_config_ini: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_STATIC_LINKER_FLAGS_ cache entry the first time a build tree is configured. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file . CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.
loc_cmake_static_linker_flags_init: Value used to initialize the CMAKE_STATIC_LINKER_FLAGS cache entry the first time a build tree is configured. This variable is meant to be set by a toolchain file . CMake may prepend or append content to the value based on the environment and target platform.
loc_cmake_sublime_text_2_env_settings: This variable contains a list of env vars as a list of tokens with the syntax var=value.
loc_cmake_sublime_text_2_exclude_build_t: If this variable evaluates to ON at the end of the top-level CMakeLists.txt file, the Sublime Text 2 extra generator excludes the build tree from the .sublime-project if it is inside the source tree.
loc_cmake_suppress_regeneration: If CMAKE_SUPPRESS_REGENERATION is OFF, which is default, then CMake adds a special target on which all other targets depend that checks the build system and optionally re-runs CMake to regenerate the build system when the target specification source changes.
loc_cmake_swift_language_version: Set to the Swift language version number. If not set, the oldest legacy version known to be available in the host Xcode version is assumed:
loc_cmake_swift_num_threads: Number of threads for parallel compilation for Swift targets.
loc_cmake_sysroot: Path to pass to the compiler in the --sysroot flag.
loc_cmake_sysroot_compile: Path to pass to the compiler in the --sysroot flag when compiling source files. This is the same as CMAKE_SYSROOT but is used only for compiling sources and not linking.
loc_cmake_sysroot_link: Path to pass to the compiler in the --sysroot flag when linking. This is the same as CMAKE_SYSROOT but is used only for linking and not compiling sources.
loc_cmake_system: Composite name of operating system CMake is compiling for.
loc_cmake_system_appbundle_path: Search path for macOS application bundles used by the find_program, and find_package commands. By default it contains the standard directories for the current system. It is not intended to be modified by the project, use CMAKE_APPBUNDLE_PATH for this.
loc_cmake_system_framework_path: Search path for macOS frameworks used by the find_library, find_package, find_path, and find_file commands. By default it contains the standard directories for the current system. It is not intended to be modified by the project, use CMAKE_FRAMEWORK_PATH for this.
loc_cmake_system_ignore_path: Semicolon-separated list  of directories to be ignored by the various find...() commands.
loc_cmake_system_ignore_prefix_path: Semicolon-separated list  of search prefixes to be ignored by the find_program, find_library, find_file, and find_path commands. The prefixes are also ignored by the Config mode of the find_package command (Module mode is unaffected). To ignore specific directories instead, see CMAKE_IGNORE_NONPREFIX_VAR.
loc_cmake_system_include_path: Semicolon-separated list  of directories specifying a search path for the find_file and find_path commands. By default this contains the standard directories for the current system. It is not intended to be modified by the project; use CMAKE_INCLUDE_PATH for this. See also CMAKE_SYSTEM_PREFIX_PATH.
loc_cmake_system_library_path: Semicolon-separated list  of directories specifying a search path for the find_library command. By default this contains the standard directories for the current system. It is not intended to be modified by the project; use CMAKE_LIBRARY_PATH for this. See also CMAKE_SYSTEM_PREFIX_PATH.
loc_cmake_system_name: The name of the operating system for which CMake is to build. See the CMAKE_SYSTEM_VERSION variable for the OS version.
loc_cmake_system_prefix_path: Semicolon-separated list  of directories specifying installation prefixes to be searched by the find_package, find_program, find_library, find_file, and find_path commands. Each command will add appropriate subdirectories (like bin, lib, or include) as specified in its own documentation.
loc_cmake_system_processor: When not cross-compiling, this variable has the same value as the CMAKE_HOST_SYSTEM_PROCESSOR variable. In many cases, this will correspond to the target architecture for the build, but this is not guaranteed. (E.g. on Windows, the host may be AMD64 even when using a MSVC cl compiler with a 32-bit target.)
loc_cmake_system_program_path: Semicolon-separated list  of directories specifying a search path for the find_program command. By default this contains the standard directories for the current system. It is not intended to be modified by the project; use CMAKE_PROGRAM_PATH for this. See also CMAKE_SYSTEM_PREFIX_PATH.
loc_cmake_system_version: The version of the operating system for which CMake is to build. See the CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME variable for the OS name.
loc_cmake_tasking_toolset: Select the Tasking toolset which provides the compiler
loc_cmake_tls_cainfo: Specify the default value for the file and file commands' TLS_CAINFO options. It is unset by default.
loc_cmake_tls_verify: Specify the default value for the file and file commands' TLS_VERIFY options. If not set, the default is off.
loc_cmake_toolchain_file: Path to toolchain file supplied to cmake.
loc_cmake_try_compile_configuration: Build configuration used for try_compile and try_run projects.
loc_cmake_try_compile_no_platform_variab: Set to a true value to tell the try_compile command not to propagate any platform variables into the test project.
loc_cmake_try_compile_platform_variables: List of variables that the try_compile command source file signature must propagate into the test project in order to target the same platform as the host project.
loc_cmake_try_compile_target_type: Type of target generated for try_compile calls using the source file signature. Valid values are:
loc_cmake_tweak_version: Defined to 0 for compatibility with code written for older CMake versions that may have defined higher values.
loc_cmake_unity_build: This variable is used to initialize the UNITY_BUILD property of targets when they are created. Setting it to true enables batch compilation of multiple sources within each target. This feature is known as a Unity or Jumbo build.
loc_cmake_unity_build_batch_size: This variable is used to initialize the UNITY_BUILD_BATCH_SIZE property of targets when they are created. It specifies the default upper limit on the number of source files that may be combined in any one unity source file when unity builds are enabled for a target.
loc_cmake_unity_build_unique_id: This variable is used to initialize the UNITY_BUILD_UNIQUE_ID property of targets when they are created. It specifies the name of the unique identifier generated per file in a unity build.
loc_cmake_user_make_rules_override: Specify a CMake file that overrides platform information.
loc_cmake_user_make_rules_override_lang: Specify a CMake file that overrides platform information for <LANG>.
loc_cmake_use_relative_paths: This variable has no effect. The partially implemented effect it had in previous releases was removed in CMake 3.4.
loc_cmake_verbose_makefile: Enable verbose output from Makefile builds.
loc_cmake_verify_interface_header_sets: This variable is used to initialize the VERIFY_INTERFACE_HEADER_SETS property of targets when they are created. Setting it to true enables header set verification.
loc_cmake_version: The CMake version string as three non-negative integer components separated by . and possibly followed by - and other information. The first two components represent the feature level and the third component represents either a bug-fix level or development date.
loc_cmake_visibility_inlines_hidden: Default value for the VISIBILITY_INLINES_HIDDEN target property when a target is created.
loc_cmake_vs_debugger_command: This variable is used to initialize the VS_DEBUGGER_COMMAND property on each target as it is created. See that target property for additional information.
loc_cmake_vs_debugger_command_arguments: This variable is used to initialize the VS_DEBUGGER_COMMAND_ARGUMENTS property on each target as it is created. See that target property for additional information.
loc_cmake_vs_debugger_environment: This variable is used to initialize the VS_DEBUGGER_ENVIRONMENT property on each target as it is created. See that target property for additional information.
loc_cmake_vs_debugger_working_directory: This variable is used to initialize the VS_DEBUGGER_WORKING_DIRECTORY property on each target as it is created. See that target property for additional information.
loc_cmake_vs_devenv_command: The generators for Visual Studio 9 2008 and above set this variable to the devenv.com command installed with the corresponding Visual Studio version. Note that this variable may be empty on Visual Studio Express editions because they do not provide this tool.
loc_cmake_vs_globals: List of Key=Value records to be set per target as target properties VS_GLOBAL_ with variable=Key and value Value.
loc_cmake_vs_include_install_to_default_: Include INSTALL target to default build.
loc_cmake_vs_include_package_to_default_: Include PACKAGE target to default build.
loc_cmake_vs_intel_fortran_project_versi: When generating for Visual Studio 9 2008 or greater with the Intel Fortran plugin installed, this specifies the .vfproj project file format version. This is intended for internal use by CMake and should not be used by project code.
loc_cmake_vs_just_my_code_debugging: Enable Just My Code with Visual Studio debugger.
loc_cmake_vs_msbuild_command: The generators for Visual Studio 12 2013 and above set this variable to the MSBuild.exe command installed with the corresponding Visual Studio version.
loc_cmake_vs_no_compile_batching: Turn off compile batching when using Visual Studio Generators.
loc_cmake_vs_nsighttegra_version: When using a Visual Studio generator with the CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME variable set to Android, this variable contains the version number of the installed NVIDIA Nsight Tegra Visual Studio Edition.
loc_cmake_vs_nuget_package_restore: When using a Visual Studio generator, this cache variable controls if msbuild should automatically attempt to restore NuGet packages prior to a build. NuGet packages can be defined using the VS_PACKAGE_REFERENCES property on a target. If no package references are defined, this setting will do nothing.
loc_cmake_vs_platform_name: Visual Studio target platform name used by the current generator.
loc_cmake_vs_platform_name_default: Default for the Visual Studio target platform name for the current generator without considering the value of the CMAKE_GENERATOR_PLATFORM variable. For Visual Studio Generators for VS 2017 and below this is always Win32. For VS 2019 and above this is based on the host platform.
loc_cmake_vs_platform_toolset_cuda: NVIDIA CUDA Toolkit version whose Visual Studio toolset to use.
loc_cmake_vs_platform_toolset_cuda_custo: Path to standalone NVIDIA CUDA Toolkit (eg. extracted from installer).
loc_cmake_vs_sdk_exclude_directories: This variable allows to override Visual Studio default Exclude Directories.
loc_cmake_vs_sdk_executable_directories: This variable allows to override Visual Studio default Executable Directories.
loc_cmake_vs_sdk_include_directories: This variable allows to override Visual Studio default Include Directories.
loc_cmake_vs_sdk_library_directories: This variable allows to override Visual Studio default Library Directories.
loc_cmake_vs_sdk_library_winrt_directori: This variable allows to override Visual Studio default Library WinRT Directories.
loc_cmake_vs_sdk_reference_directories: This variable allows to override Visual Studio default Reference Directories.
loc_cmake_vs_sdk_source_directories: This variable allows to override Visual Studio default Source Directories.
loc_cmake_vs_target_framework_targets_ve: Visual Studio target framework targets version.
loc_cmake_vs_windows_target_platform_min: Tell Visual Studio Generators to use the given Windows Target Platform Minimum Version.
loc_cmake_vs_windows_target_platform_ver: Visual Studio Windows Target Platform Version.
Override the Windows 10 SDK Maximum Version for VS 2015 and beyond.
loc_cmake_vs_winrt_by_default: Inform Visual Studio Generators for VS 2010 and above that the target platform enables WinRT compilation by default and it needs to be explicitly disabled if /ZW or VS_WINRT_COMPONENT is omitted (as opposed to enabling it when either of those options is present)
loc_cmake_warn_deprecated: Whether to issue warnings for deprecated functionality.
loc_cmake_warn_on_absolute_install_desti: Ask cmake_install.cmake script to warn each time a file with absolute INSTALL DESTINATION is encountered.
loc_cmake_watcom_runtime_library: Select the Watcom runtime library for use by compilers targeting the Watcom ABI. This variable is used to initialize the WATCOM_RUNTIME_LIBRARY property on all targets as they are created. It is also propagated by calls to the try_compile command into the test project.
loc_cmake_win32_executable: Default value for WIN32_EXECUTABLE of targets.
loc_cmake_windows_export_all_symbols: Default value for WINDOWS_EXPORT_ALL_SYMBOLS target property. This variable is used to initialize the property on each target as it is created.
loc_cmake_xcode_generate_scheme: If enabled, the Xcode generator will generate schema files. These are useful to invoke analyze, archive, build-for-testing and test actions from the command line.
loc_cmake_xcode_generate_top_level_proje: If enabled, the Xcode generator will generate only a single Xcode project file for the topmost project() command instead of generating one for every project() command.
loc_cmake_xcode_link_build_phase_mode: This variable is used to initialize the XCODE_LINK_BUILD_PHASE_MODE property on targets. It affects the methods that the Xcode generator uses to link different kinds of libraries. Its default value is NONE.
loc_cmake_xcode_scheme_address_sanitizer: Whether to enable Address Sanitizer in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.
Whether to enable Detect use of stack after return in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_cmake_xcode_scheme_debug_document_ve: Whether to enable Allow debugging when using document Versions Browser in the Options section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_cmake_xcode_scheme_disable_main_thre: Whether to disable the Main Thread Checker in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_cmake_xcode_scheme_dynamic_library_l: Whether to enable Dynamic Library Loads in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_cmake_xcode_scheme_dynamic_linker_ap: Whether to enable Dynamic Linker API usage in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_cmake_xcode_scheme_enable_gpu_api_va: Property value for Metal: API Validation in the Options section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_cmake_xcode_scheme_enable_gpu_frame_: Property value for GPU Frame Capture in the Options section of the generated Xcode scheme. Example values are Metal and Disabled.
loc_cmake_xcode_scheme_enable_gpu_shader: Property value for Metal: Shader Validation in the Options section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_cmake_xcode_scheme_environment: Specify environment variables that should be added to the Arguments section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_cmake_xcode_scheme_guard_malloc: Whether to enable Guard Malloc in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_cmake_xcode_scheme_launch_configurat: Set the build configuration to run the target.
loc_cmake_xcode_scheme_launch_mode: Property value for Launch in the Info section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_cmake_xcode_scheme_main_thread_check: Whether to enable the Main Thread Checker option Pause on issues in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_cmake_xcode_scheme_malloc_guard_edge: Whether to enable Malloc Guard Edges in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_cmake_xcode_scheme_malloc_scribble: Whether to enable Malloc Scribble in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_cmake_xcode_scheme_malloc_stack: Whether to enable Malloc Stack in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_cmake_xcode_scheme_thread_sanitizer: Whether to enable Thread Sanitizer in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_cmake_xcode_scheme_thread_sanitizer_: Whether to enable Thread Sanitizer - Pause on issues in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_cmake_xcode_scheme_undefined_behavio: Whether to enable Undefined Behavior Sanitizer in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.
Whether to enable Undefined Behavior Sanitizer option Pause on issues in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_cmake_xcode_scheme_working_directory: Specify the Working Directory of the Run and Profile actions in the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_cmake_xcode_scheme_zombie_objects: Whether to enable Zombie Objects in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_cmake_xcode_xcconfig: If set, the Xcode generator will register the specified file as a global XCConfig file. For target-level XCConfig files see the XCODE_XCCONFIG target property.
loc_cpack_absolute_destination_files: List of files which have been installed using an ABSOLUTE DESTINATION path.
loc_cpack_component_include_toplevel_dir: Boolean toggle to include/exclude top level directory (component case).
loc_cpack_custom_install_variables: CPack variables (set via e.g. cpack -D, CPackConfig.cmake or CPACK_PROJECT_CONFIG_FILE scripts) are not directly visible in installation scripts. Instead, one can pass a list of varName=value pairs in the CPACK_CUSTOM_INSTALL_VARIABLES variable. At install time, each list item will result in a variable of the specified name (varName) being set to the given value. The = can be omitted for an empty value.
loc_cpack_error_on_absolute_install_dest: Ask CPack to error out as soon as a file with absolute INSTALL DESTINATION is encountered.
loc_cpack_include_toplevel_directory: Boolean toggle to include/exclude top level directory.
loc_cpack_install_default_directory_perm: Default permissions for implicitly created directories during packaging.
loc_cpack_packaging_install_prefix: The prefix used in the built package.
loc_cpack_set_destdir: Boolean toggle to make CPack use DESTDIR mechanism when packaging.
loc_cpack_warn_on_absolute_install_desti: Ask CPack to warn each time a file with absolute INSTALL DESTINATION is encountered.
loc_ctest_binary_directory: Specify the CTest BuildDirectory setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_build_command: Specify the CTest MakeCommand setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_build_name: Specify the CTest BuildName setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_bzr_command: Specify the CTest BZRCommand setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_bzr_update_options: Specify the CTest BZRUpdateOptions setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_change_id: Specify the CTest ChangeId setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_checkout_command: Tell the ctest_start command how to checkout or initialize the source directory in a ctest dashboard client script.
