loc_ctest_configuration_type: Specify the CTest DefaultCTestConfigurationType setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_configure_command: Specify the CTest ConfigureCommand setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_coverage_command: Specify the CTest CoverageCommand setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_coverage_extra_flags: Specify the CTest CoverageExtraFlags setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_curl_options: Specify the CTest CurlOptions setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_custom_coverage_exclude: A list of regular expressions which will be used to exclude files by their path from coverage output by the ctest_coverage command.
loc_ctest_custom_error_exception: A list of regular expressions which will be used to exclude when detecting error messages in build outputs by the ctest_build command.
loc_ctest_custom_error_match: A list of regular expressions which will be used to detect error messages in build outputs by the ctest_build command.
loc_ctest_custom_error_post_context: The number of lines to include as context which follow an error message by the ctest_build command. The default is 10.
loc_ctest_custom_error_pre_context: The number of lines to include as context which precede an error message by the ctest_build command. The default is 10.
loc_ctest_custom_maximum_failed_test_out: When saving a failing test's output, this is the maximum size, in bytes, that will be collected by the ctest_test command. Defaults to 307200 (300 KiB). See CTEST_CUSTOM_TEST_OUTPUT_TRUNCATION for possible truncation modes.
loc_ctest_custom_maximum_number_of_error: The maximum number of errors in a single build step which will be detected. After this, the ctest_test command will truncate the output. Defaults to 50.
loc_ctest_custom_maximum_number_of_warni: The maximum number of warnings in a single build step which will be detected. After this, the ctest_test command will truncate the output. Defaults to 50.
loc_ctest_custom_maximum_passed_test_out: When saving a passing test's output, this is the maximum size, in bytes, that will be collected by the ctest_test command. Defaults to 1024 (1 KiB). See CTEST_CUSTOM_TEST_OUTPUT_TRUNCATION for possible truncation modes.
loc_ctest_custom_memcheck_ignore: A list of regular expressions to use to exclude tests during the ctest_memcheck command.
loc_ctest_custom_post_memcheck: A list of commands to run at the end of the ctest_memcheck command.
loc_ctest_custom_post_test: A list of commands to run at the end of the ctest_test command.
loc_ctest_custom_pre_memcheck: A list of commands to run at the start of the ctest_memcheck command.
loc_ctest_custom_pre_test: A list of commands to run at the start of the ctest_test command.
loc_ctest_custom_tests_ignore: A list of test names to be excluded from the set of tests run by the ctest_test command.
loc_ctest_custom_test_output_truncation: Set the test output truncation mode in case a maximum size is configured via the CTEST_CUSTOM_MAXIMUM_PASSED_TEST_OUTPUT_SIZE or CTEST_CUSTOM_MAXIMUM_FAILED_TEST_OUTPUT_SIZE variables. By default the tail of the output will be truncated. Other possible values are middle and head.
loc_ctest_custom_warning_exception: A list of regular expressions which will be used to exclude when detecting warning messages in build outputs by the ctest_build command.
loc_ctest_custom_warning_match: A list of regular expressions which will be used to detect warning messages in build outputs by the ctest_build command.
loc_ctest_cvs_command: Specify the CTest CVSCommand setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_cvs_update_options: Specify the CTest CVSUpdateOptions setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_drop_location: Specify the CTest DropLocation setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_drop_method: Specify the CTest DropMethod setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_drop_site: Specify the CTest DropSite setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_drop_site_cdash: Specify the CTest IsCDash setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_drop_site_password: Specify the CTest DropSitePassword setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_drop_site_user: Specify the CTest DropSiteUser setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_extra_coverage_glob: A list of regular expressions which will be used to find files which should be covered by the ctest_coverage command.
loc_ctest_git_command: Specify the CTest GITCommand setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_git_init_submodules: Specify the CTest GITInitSubmodules setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_git_update_custom: Specify the CTest GITUpdateCustom setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_git_update_options: Specify the CTest GITUpdateOptions setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_hg_command: Specify the CTest HGCommand setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_hg_update_options: Specify the CTest HGUpdateOptions setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_labels_for_subprojects: Specify the CTest LabelsForSubprojects setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_memorycheck_command: Specify the CTest MemoryCheckCommand setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_memorycheck_command_options: Specify the CTest MemoryCheckCommandOptions setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_memorycheck_sanitizer_options: Specify the CTest MemoryCheckSanitizerOptions setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_memorycheck_suppressions_file: Specify the CTest MemoryCheckSuppressionFile setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_memorycheck_type: Specify the CTest MemoryCheckType setting in a ctest dashboard client script. Valid values are Valgrind, Purify, BoundsChecker, DrMemory, CudaSanitizer, ThreadSanitizer, AddressSanitizer, LeakSanitizer, MemorySanitizer and UndefinedBehaviorSanitizer.
loc_ctest_nightly_start_time: Specify the CTest NightlyStartTime setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_p4_client: Specify the CTest P4Client setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_p4_command: Specify the CTest P4Command setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_p4_options: Specify the CTest P4Options setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_p4_update_options: Specify the CTest P4UpdateOptions setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_resource_spec_file: Specify the CTest ResourceSpecFile setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_run_current_script: Setting this to 0 prevents ctest from being run again when it reaches the end of a script run by calling ctest -S.
loc_ctest_script_directory: The directory containing the top-level CTest script. The concept is similar to CMAKE_SOURCE_DIR.
loc_ctest_site: Specify the CTest Site setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_source_directory: Specify the CTest SourceDirectory setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_submit_inactivity_timeout: Specify the CTest SubmitInactivityTimeout setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_submit_url: Specify the CTest SubmitURL setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_svn_command: Specify the CTest SVNCommand setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_svn_options: Specify the CTest SVNOptions setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_svn_update_options: Specify the CTest SVNUpdateOptions setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_test_load: Specify the TestLoad setting in the CTest Test Step of a ctest dashboard client script. This sets the default value for the TEST_LOAD option of the ctest_test command.
loc_ctest_test_timeout: Specify the CTest TimeOut setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_update_command: Specify the CTest UpdateCommand setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_update_options: Specify the CTest UpdateOptions setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_update_version_only: Specify the CTest UpdateVersionOnly  setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_update_version_override: Specify the CTest UpdateVersionOverride  setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ctest_use_launchers: Specify the CTest UseLaunchers setting in a ctest dashboard client script.
loc_ghsmulti: 1 when using Green Hills MULTI generator.
loc_ios: Set to 1 when the target system (CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME) is iOS.
loc_linux: Set to true when the target system is Linux.
loc_mingw: Set to a true value when at least one language is enabled with a compiler targeting the GNU ABI on Windows (MinGW).
loc_msvc: Set to true when the compiler is some version of Microsoft Visual C++ or another compiler simulating the Visual C++ cl command-line syntax.
loc_msvc10: Discouraged. Use the MSVC_VERSION variable instead.
loc_msvc11: Discouraged. Use the MSVC_VERSION variable instead.
loc_msvc12: Discouraged. Use the MSVC_VERSION variable instead.
loc_msvc14: Discouraged. Use the MSVC_VERSION variable instead.
loc_msvc60: Discouraged. Use the MSVC_VERSION variable instead.
loc_msvc70: Discouraged. Use the MSVC_VERSION variable instead.
loc_msvc71: Discouraged. Use the MSVC_VERSION variable instead.
loc_msvc80: Discouraged. Use the MSVC_VERSION variable instead.
loc_msvc90: Discouraged. Use the MSVC_VERSION variable instead.
loc_msvc_ide: True when using the Microsoft Visual C++ IDE.
loc_msvc_toolset_version: The toolset version of Microsoft Visual C/C++ being used if any. If MSVC-like is being used, this variable is set based on the version of the compiler as given by the MSVC_VERSION variable.
loc_msvc_version: The version of Microsoft Visual C/C++ being used if any. If a compiler simulating Visual C++ is being used, this variable is set to the toolset version simulated as given by the _MSC_VER preprocessor definition.
loc_msys: True when using the MSYS Makefiles generator.
loc_packagename_root: Calls to find_package(<PackageName>) will search in prefixes specified by the <PackageName>_ROOT CMake variable, where <PackageName> is the (case-preserved) name given to the find_package call and _ROOT is literal. For example, find_package(Foo) will search prefixes specified in the Foo_ROOT CMake variable (if set). See policy CMP0074.
loc_projectname_binary_dir: Top level binary directory for the named project.
loc_projectname_description: Value given to the DESCRIPTION option of the most recent call to the project command with project name <PROJECT-NAME>, if any.
loc_projectname_homepage_url: Value given to the HOMEPAGE_URL option of the most recent call to the project command with project name <PROJECT-NAME>, if any.
loc_projectname_is_top_level: A boolean variable indicating whether the named project was called in a top level CMakeLists.txt file.
loc_projectname_source_dir: Top level source directory for the named project.
loc_projectname_version: Value given to the VERSION option of the most recent call to the project command with project name <PROJECT-NAME>, if any.
loc_projectname_version_major: First version number component of the <PROJECT-NAME>_VERSION variable as set by the project command.
loc_projectname_version_minor: Second version number component of the <PROJECT-NAME>_VERSION variable as set by the project command.
loc_projectname_version_patch: Third version number component of the <PROJECT-NAME>_VERSION variable as set by the project command.
loc_projectname_version_tweak: Fourth version number component of the <PROJECT-NAME>_VERSION variable as set by the project command.
loc_project_binary_dir: Full path to build directory for project.
loc_project_description: Short project description given to the project command.
loc_project_homepage_url: The homepage URL of the project.
loc_project_is_top_level: A boolean variable indicating whether the most recently called project command in the current scope or above was in the top level CMakeLists.txt file.
loc_project_name: Name of the project given to the project command.
loc_project_source_dir: This is the source directory of the last call to the project command made in the current directory scope or one of its parents. Note, it is not affected by calls to project made within a child directory scope (i.e. from within a call to add_subdirectory from the current scope).
loc_project_version: Value given to the VERSION option of the most recent call to the project command, if any.
loc_project_version_major: First version number component of the PROJECT_VERSION variable as set by the project command.
loc_project_version_minor: Second version number component of the PROJECT_VERSION variable as set by the project command.
loc_project_version_patch: Third version number component of the PROJECT_VERSION variable as set by the project command.
loc_project_version_tweak: Fourth version number component of the PROJECT_VERSION variable as set by the project command.
loc_unix: Set to True when the target system is UNIX or UNIX-like (e.g. APPLE and CYGWIN). The CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME variable should be queried if a more specific understanding of the target system is required.
loc_win32: Set to True when the target system is Windows, including Win64.
loc_wince: True when the CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME variable is set to WindowsCE.
loc_windows_phone: True when the CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME variable is set to WindowsPhone.
loc_windows_store: True when the CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME variable is set to WindowsStore.
loc_advanced: True if entry should be hidden by default in GUIs.
loc_helpstring: Help associated with entry in GUIs.
loc_modified: Internal management property. Do not set or get.
loc_strings: Enumerate possible STRING entry values for GUI selection.
loc_type: Widget type for entry in GUIs.
loc_additional_clean_files: A Semicolon-separated list  of files or directories that will be removed as a part of the global clean target. It is useful for specifying generated files or directories that are used by multiple targets or by CMake itself, or that are generated in ways which cannot be captured as outputs or byproducts of custom commands.
loc_additional_make_clean_files: Additional files to remove during the clean stage.
loc_binary_dir: This read-only directory property reports absolute path to the binary directory corresponding to the source on which it is read.
loc_buildsystem_targets: This read-only directory property contains a semicolon-separated list  of buildsystem targets added in the directory by calls to the add_library, add_executable, and add_custom_target commands. The list does not include any Imported Targets or Alias Targets, but does include Interface Libraries. Each entry in the list is the logical name of a target, suitable to pass to the get_property command TARGET option.
loc_cache_variables: List of cache variables available in the current directory.
loc_clean_no_custom: Set to true to tell Makefile Generators not to remove the outputs of custom commands for this directory during the make clean operation. This is ignored on other generators because it is not possible to implement.
loc_cmake_configure_depends: Tell CMake about additional input files to the configuration process. If any named file is modified the build system will re-run CMake to re-configure the file and generate the build system again.
loc_compile_definitions: Preprocessor definitions for compiling a directory's sources.
loc_compile_options: List of options to pass to the compiler.
loc_definitions: For CMake 2.4 compatibility only. Use COMPILE_DEFINITIONS instead.
loc_exclude_from_all: Set this directory property to a true value on a subdirectory to exclude its targets from the "all" target of its ancestors. If excluded, running e.g. make in the parent directory will not build targets the subdirectory by default. This does not affect the "all" target of the subdirectory itself. Running e.g. make inside the subdirectory will still build its targets.
loc_implicit_depends_include_transform: Specify #include line transforms for dependencies in a directory.
loc_imported_targets: This read-only directory property contains a semicolon-separated list  of Imported Targets added in the directory by calls to the add_library and add_executable commands. Each entry in the list is the logical name of a target, suitable to pass to the get_property command TARGET option when called in the same directory.
loc_interprocedural_optimization: This directory property does not exist anymore.
loc_interprocedural_optimization_config: This directory property does not exist anymore.
loc_labels: Specify a list of text labels associated with a directory and all of its subdirectories. This is equivalent to setting the LABELS target property and the LABELS test property on all targets and tests in the current directory and subdirectories. Note: Launchers must enabled to propagate labels to targets.
loc_link_options: List of options to use for the link step of shared library, module and executable targets as well as the device link step.
loc_listfile_stack: The current stack of listfiles being processed.
loc_macros: List of macro commands available in the current directory.
loc_parent_directory: Source directory that added current subdirectory.
loc_rule_launch_compile: Specify a launcher for compile rules.
loc_rule_launch_custom: Specify a launcher for custom rules.
loc_rule_launch_link: Specify a launcher for link rules.
loc_source_dir: This read-only directory property reports absolute path to the source directory on which it is read.
loc_subdirectories: This read-only directory property contains a semicolon-separated list  of subdirectories processed so far by the add_subdirectory or subdirs commands. Each entry is the absolute path to the source directory (containing the CMakeLists.txt file). This is suitable to pass to the get_property command DIRECTORY option.
loc_system: This directory property is used to initialize the SYSTEM target property for non-imported targets created in that directory. It is set to true by add_subdirectory and FetchContent_Declare when the SYSTEM option is given as an argument to those commands.
loc_test_include_files: A list of cmake files that will be included when ctest is run.
loc_variables: List of variables defined in the current directory.
loc_vs_global_section_post_section: Specify a postSolution global section in Visual Studio.
loc_vs_global_section_pre_section: Specify a preSolution global section in Visual Studio.
loc_vs_startup_project: Specify the default startup project in a Visual Studio solution.
loc_allow_duplicate_custom_targets: Allow duplicate custom targets to be created.
loc_autogen_source_group: Name of the source_group for AUTOMOC, AUTORCC and AUTOUIC generated files.
loc_autogen_targets_folder: Name of FOLDER for *_autogen targets that are added automatically by CMake for targets for which AUTOMOC is enabled.
loc_automoc_source_group: Name of the source_group for AUTOMOC generated files.
loc_automoc_targets_folder: Name of FOLDER for *_autogen targets that are added automatically by CMake for targets for which AUTOMOC is enabled.
loc_autorcc_source_group: Name of the source_group for AUTORCC generated files.
loc_autouic_source_group: Name of the source_group for AUTOUIC generated files.
loc_cmake_cuda_known_features: List of CUDA features known to this version of CMake.
loc_cmake_cxx_known_features: List of C++ features known to this version of CMake.
loc_cmake_c_known_features: List of C features known to this version of CMake.
loc_cmake_role: Tells what mode the current running script is in. Could be one of several values:
loc_debug_configurations: Specify which configurations are for debugging.
loc_disabled_features: List of features which are disabled during the CMake run.
loc_eclipse_extra_cproject_contents: Additional contents to be inserted into the generated Eclipse cproject file.
loc_eclipse_extra_natures: List of natures to add to the generated Eclipse project file.
loc_enabled_features: List of features which are enabled during the CMake run.
loc_enabled_languages: Read-only property that contains the list of currently enabled languages
loc_find_library_use_lib32_paths: Whether the find_library command should automatically search lib32 directories.
loc_find_library_use_lib64_paths: Whether find_library should automatically search lib64 directories.
loc_find_library_use_libx32_paths: Whether the find_library command should automatically search libx32 directories.
loc_find_library_use_openbsd_versioning: Whether find_library should find OpenBSD-style shared libraries.
loc_generator_is_multi_config: Read-only property that is true on multi-configuration generators.
loc_global_depends_debug_mode: Enable global target dependency graph debug mode.
loc_global_depends_no_cycles: Disallow global target dependency graph cycles.
loc_in_try_compile: Read-only property that is true during a try-compile configuration.
loc_job_pools: Ninja only: List of available pools.
loc_packages_found: List of packages which were found during the CMake run.
loc_packages_not_found: List of packages which were not found during the CMake run.
loc_predefined_targets_folder: Name of FOLDER for targets that are added automatically by CMake.
loc_report_undefined_properties: If set, report any undefined properties to this file.
loc_rule_messages: Specify whether to report a message for each make rule.
loc_target_archives_may_be_shared_libs: Set if shared libraries may be named like archives.
loc_target_messages: Specify whether to report the completion of each target.
loc_target_supports_shared_libs: Does the target platform support shared libraries.
loc_use_folders: Controls whether to use the FOLDER target property to organize targets into folders. The value of USE_FOLDERS at the end of the top level CMakeLists.txt file is what determines the behavior.
loc_xcode_emit_effective_platform_name: Control emission of EFFECTIVE_PLATFORM_NAME by the Xcode generator.
loc_cpack_desktop_shortcuts: Species a list of shortcut names that should be created on the Desktop for this file.
loc_cpack_never_overwrite: Request that this file not be overwritten on install or reinstall.
loc_cpack_permanent: Request that this file not be removed on uninstall.
loc_cpack_startup_shortcuts: Species a list of shortcut names that should be created in the Startup folder for this file.
loc_cpack_start_menu_shortcuts: Species a list of shortcut names that should be created in the Start Menu for this file.
loc_cpack_wix_acl: Specifies access permissions for files or directories installed by a WiX installer.
loc_abstract: Is this source file an abstract class.
loc_autorcc_options: Additional options for rcc when using AUTORCC
loc_autouic_options: Additional options for uic when using AUTOUIC
loc_compile_flags: Additional flags to be added when compiling this source file.
loc_cxx_scan_for_modules: CXX_SCAN_FOR_MODULES is a boolean specifying whether CMake will scan the source for C++ module dependencies. See also the CXX_SCAN_FOR_MODULES for target-wide settings.
loc_external_object: If set to true then this is an object file.
loc_fortran_format: Set to FIXED or FREE to indicate the Fortran source layout.
loc_fortran_preprocess: Control whether the Fortran source file should be unconditionally preprocessed.
loc_generated: Is this source file generated as part of the build or CMake process.
loc_header_file_only: Is this source file only a header file.
loc_keep_extension: Make the output file have the same extension as the source file.
loc_language: Specify the programming language in which a source file is written.
loc_location: The full path to a source file.
loc_macosx_package_location: Place a source file inside a Application Bundle (MACOSX_BUNDLE), Core Foundation Bundle (BUNDLE), or Framework Bundle (FRAMEWORK). It is applicable for macOS and iOS.
loc_object_depends: Additional files on which a compiled object file depends.
loc_object_outputs: Additional outputs for a Ninja or Makefile Generators rule.
loc_skip_autogen: Exclude the source file from AUTOMOC, AUTOUIC and AUTORCC processing (for Qt projects).
loc_skip_automoc: Exclude the source file from AUTOMOC processing (for Qt projects).
loc_skip_autorcc: Exclude the source file from AUTORCC processing (for Qt projects).
loc_skip_autouic: Exclude the source file from AUTOUIC processing (for Qt projects).
loc_skip_linting: This property allows you to exclude a specific source file from the linting process. The linting process involves running tools such as <LANG>_CPPLINT, <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY, <LANG>_CPPCHECK, and <LANG>_INCLUDE_WHAT_YOU_USE on the source files, as well as compiling header files as part of VERIFY_INTERFACE_HEADER_SETS. By setting SKIP_LINTING on a source file, the mentioned linting tools will not be executed for that particular file.
loc_skip_precompile_headers: Is this source file skipped by PRECOMPILE_HEADERS feature.
loc_skip_unity_build_inclusion: Setting this property to true ensures the source file will be skipped by unity builds when its associated target has its UNITY_BUILD property set to true. The source file will instead be compiled on its own in the same way as it would with unity builds disabled.
loc_swift_dependencies_file: This property sets the path for the Swift dependency file (swiftdeps) for the source. If one is not specified, it will default to <OBJECT>.swiftdeps.
loc_swift_diagnostics_file: This property controls where the Swift diagnostics are serialized.
loc_symbolic: Is this just a name for a rule.
loc_unity_group: This property controls which bucket the source will be part of when the UNITY_BUILD_MODE is set to GROUP.
loc_vs_copy_to_out_dir: Sets the <CopyToOutputDirectory> tag for a source file in a Visual Studio project file. Valid values are Never, Always and PreserveNewest.
loc_vs_csharp_tagname: Visual Studio and CSharp source-file-specific configuration.
loc_vs_deployment_content: Mark a source file as content for deployment with a Windows Phone or Windows Store application when built with a Visual Studio generators <cmake-generators(7)>. The value must evaluate to either 1 or 0 and may use generator expressions <cmake-generator-expressions(7)> to make the choice based on the build configuration. The .vcxproj file entry for the source file will be marked either DeploymentContent or ExcludedFromBuild for values 1 and 0, respectively.
loc_vs_deployment_location: Specifies the deployment location for a content source file with a Windows Phone or Windows Store application when built with a Visual Studio generators <cmake-generators(7)>. This property is only applicable when using VS_DEPLOYMENT_CONTENT. The value represent the path relative to the app package and applies to all configurations.
loc_vs_include_in_vsix: Boolean property to specify if the file should be included within a VSIX (Visual Studio Integration Extension) extension package. This is needed for development of Visual Studio extensions.
loc_vs_resource_generator: This property allows to specify the resource generator to be used on this file. It defaults to PublicResXFileCodeGenerator if not set.
loc_vs_settings: Set any item metadata on a file.
loc_vs_shader_disable_optimizations: Disable compiler optimizations for an .hlsl source file. This adds the -Od flag to the command line for the FxCompiler tool. Specify the value true for this property to disable compiler optimizations.
loc_vs_shader_enable_debug: Enable debugging information for an .hlsl source file. This adds the -Zi flag to the command line for the FxCompiler tool. Specify the value true to generate debugging information for the compiled shader.
loc_vs_shader_entrypoint: Specifies the name of the entry point for the shader of a .hlsl source file.
loc_vs_shader_flags: Set additional Visual Studio shader flags of a .hlsl source file.
loc_vs_shader_model: Specifies the shader model of a .hlsl source file. Some shader types can only be used with recent shader models
loc_vs_shader_object_file_name: Specifies a file name for the compiled shader object file for an .hlsl source file. This adds the -Fo flag to the command line for the FxCompiler tool.
loc_vs_shader_output_header_file: Set filename for output header file containing object code of a .hlsl source file.
loc_vs_shader_type: Set the Visual Studio shader type of a .hlsl source file.
loc_vs_shader_variable_name: Set name of variable in header file containing object code of a .hlsl source file.
loc_vs_tool_override: Override the default Visual Studio tool that will be applied to the source file with a new tool not based on the extension of the file.
loc_vs_xaml_type: Mark a Extensible Application Markup Language (XAML) source file as a different type than the default Page. The most common usage would be to set the default App.xaml file as ApplicationDefinition.
loc_wrap_exclude: Exclude this source file from any code wrapping techniques.
loc_xcode_explicit_file_type: Set the Xcode explicitFileType attribute on its reference to a source file. CMake computes a default based on file extension but can be told explicitly with this property.
loc_xcode_file_attributes: Add values to the Xcode ATTRIBUTES setting on its reference to a source file. Among other things, this can be used to set the role on a .mig file:
loc_xcode_last_known_file_type: Set the Xcode lastKnownFileType attribute on its reference to a source file. CMake computes a default based on file extension but can be told explicitly with this property.
loc_attached_files: Attach a list of files to a dashboard submission.
loc_attached_files_on_fail: Attach a list of files to a dashboard submission if the test fails.
loc_cost: This property describes the cost of a test. When parallel testing is enabled, tests in the test set will be run in descending order of cost. Projects can explicitly define the cost of a test by setting this property to a floating point value.
loc_depends: Specifies that this test should only be run after the specified list of tests.
loc_disabled: If set to True, the test will be skipped and its status will be 'Not Run'. A DISABLED test will not be counted in the total number of tests and its completion status will be reported to CDash as Disabled.
loc_environment: Specify environment variables that should be defined for running a test.
loc_environment_modification: Specify environment variables that should be modified for running a test. Note that the operations performed by this property are performed after the ENVIRONMENT property is already applied.
loc_fail_regular_expression: If the output matches this regular expression the test will fail, regardless of the process exit code.
loc_fixtures_cleanup: Specifies a list of fixtures for which the test is to be treated as a cleanup test. These fixture names are distinct from test case names and are not required to have any similarity to the names of tests associated with them.
loc_fixtures_required: Specifies a list of fixtures the test requires. Fixture names are case sensitive and they are not required to have any similarity to test names.
loc_fixtures_setup: Specifies a list of fixtures for which the test is to be treated as a setup test. These fixture names are distinct from test case names and are not required to have any similarity to the names of tests associated with them.
loc_generated_resource_spec_file: Path to the dynamically-generated resource spec file <ctest-resource-dynamically-generated-spec-file> generated by this test.
loc_measurement: Specify a CDASH measurement and value to be reported for a test.
loc_pass_regular_expression: The output must match this regular expression for the test to pass. The process exit code is ignored.
loc_processors: Set to specify how many process slots this test requires. If not set, the default is 1 processor.
loc_processor_affinity: Set to a true value to ask CTest to launch the test process with CPU affinity for a fixed set of processors. If enabled and supported for the current platform, CTest will choose a set of processors to place in the CPU affinity mask when launching the test process. The number of processors in the set is determined by the PROCESSORS test property or the number of processors available to CTest, whichever is smaller. The set of processors chosen will be disjoint from the processors assigned to other concurrently running tests that also have the PROCESSOR_AFFINITY property enabled.
loc_required_files: List of files required to run the test. The filenames are relative to the test WORKING_DIRECTORY unless an absolute path is specified.
loc_resource_groups: Specify resources required by a test, grouped in a way that is meaningful to the test. See resource allocation <ctest-resource-allocation> for more information on how this property integrates into the CTest resource allocation feature.
loc_resource_lock: Specify a list of resources that are locked by this test.
loc_run_serial: Do not run this test in parallel with any other test.
loc_skip_regular_expression: If the output matches this regular expression the test will be marked as skipped.
loc_skip_return_code: Return code to mark a test as skipped.
loc_timeout: How many seconds to allow for this test.
loc_timeout_after_match: Change a test's timeout duration after a matching line is encountered in its output.
loc_timeout_signal_grace_period: If the TIMEOUT_SIGNAL_NAME test property is set, this property specifies the number of seconds to wait for a test process to terminate after sending the custom signal. Otherwise, this property has no meaning.
loc_timeout_signal_name: Specify a custom signal to send to a test process when its timeout is reached. This is available only on platforms supporting POSIX signals. It is not available on Windows.
loc_will_fail: If set to true, this will invert the pass/fail flag of the test.
loc_working_directory: The directory from which the test executable will be called.
loc_aix_export_all_symbols: On AIX, CMake automatically exports all symbols from shared libraries, and from executables with the ENABLE_EXPORTS target property set. Explicitly disable this boolean property to suppress the behavior and export no symbols by default. In this case it is expected that the project will use other means to export some symbols.
loc_aliased_target: Name of target aliased by this target.
loc_alias_global: Read-only property indicating of whether an ALIAS target  is globally visible.
loc_android_ant_additional_options: Set the additional options for Android Ant build system. This is a string value containing all command line options for the Ant build. This property is initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_ANT_ADDITIONAL_OPTIONS variable if it is set when a target is created.
loc_android_api: When Cross Compiling for Android with NVIDIA Nsight Tegra Visual Studio Edition, this property sets the Android target API version (e.g. 15). The version number must be a positive decimal integer. This property is initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_API variable if it is set when a target is created.
loc_android_api_min: Set the Android MIN API version (e.g. 9). The version number must be a positive decimal integer. This property is initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_API_MIN variable if it is set when a target is created. Native code builds using this API version.
loc_android_arch: When Cross Compiling for Android with NVIDIA Nsight Tegra Visual Studio Edition, this property sets the Android target architecture.
loc_android_assets_directories: Set the Android assets directories to copy into the main assets folder before build. This a string property that contains the directory paths separated by semicolon. This property is initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_ASSETS_DIRECTORIES variable if it is set when a target is created.
loc_android_gui: When Cross Compiling for Android with NVIDIA Nsight Tegra Visual Studio Edition, this property specifies whether to build an executable as an application package on Android.
loc_android_jar_dependencies: Set the Android property that specifies JAR dependencies. This is a string value property. This property is initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_JAR_DEPENDENCIES variable if it is set when a target is created.
loc_android_jar_directories: Set the Android property that specifies directories to search for the JAR libraries.
loc_android_java_source_dir: Set the Android property that defines the Java source code root directories. This a string property that contains the directory paths separated by semicolon. This property is initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_JAVA_SOURCE_DIR variable if it is set when a target is created.
loc_android_native_lib_dependencies: Set the Android property that specifies the .so dependencies. This is a string property.
loc_android_native_lib_directories: Set the Android property that specifies directories to search for the .so libraries.
loc_android_process_max: Set the Android property that defines the maximum number of a parallel Android NDK compiler processes (e.g. 4). This property is initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_PROCESS_MAX variable if it is set when a target is created.
loc_android_proguard: When this property is set to true that enables the ProGuard tool to shrink, optimize, and obfuscate the code by removing unused code and renaming classes, fields, and methods with semantically obscure names. This property is initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_PROGUARD variable if it is set when a target is created.
loc_android_proguard_config_path: Set the Android property that specifies the location of the ProGuard config file. Leave empty to use the default one. This a string property that contains the path to ProGuard config file. This property is initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_PROGUARD_CONFIG_PATH variable if it is set when a target is created.
loc_android_secure_props_path: Set the Android property that states the location of the secure properties file. This is a string property that contains the file path. This property is initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_SECURE_PROPS_PATH variable if it is set when a target is created.
loc_android_skip_ant_step: Set the Android property that defines whether or not to skip the Ant build step. This is a boolean property initialized by the value of the CMAKE_ANDROID_SKIP_ANT_STEP variable if it is set when a target is created.
loc_android_stl_type: When Cross Compiling for Android with NVIDIA Nsight Tegra Visual Studio Edition, this property specifies the type of STL support for the project. This is a string property that could set to the one of the following values:
loc_archive_output_directory: Output directory in which to build XXX target files.
loc_archive_output_directory_config: Per-configuration output directory for ARCHIVE  target files.
loc_archive_output_name: Output name for XXX target files.
loc_archive_output_name_config: Per-configuration output name for ARCHIVE  target files.
loc_autogen_build_dir: Directory where AUTOMOC, AUTOUIC and AUTORCC generate files for the target.
loc_autogen_origin_depends: Switch for forwarding origin target dependencies to the corresponding _autogen target.
loc_autogen_parallel: Number of parallel moc or uic processes to start when using AUTOMOC and AUTOUIC.
loc_autogen_target_depends: Additional target dependencies of the corresponding _autogen target.
loc_autogen_use_system_include: AUTOGEN_USE_SYSTEM_INCLUDE is a boolean property that can be set on a target to indicate that the autogen target include directory should be added as a system include directory or normal include directory to the target.
loc_automoc: Should the target be processed with auto-moc (for Qt projects).
loc_automoc_compiler_predefines: Boolean value used by AUTOMOC to determine if the compiler pre definitions file moc_predefs.h should be generated.
loc_automoc_depend_filters: Filter definitions used by AUTOMOC to extract file names from a source file that are registered as additional dependencies for the moc file of the source file.
loc_automoc_executable: AUTOMOC_EXECUTABLE is file path pointing to the moc executable to use for AUTOMOC enabled files. Setting this property will make CMake skip the automatic detection of the moc binary as well as the sanity-tests normally run to ensure that the binary is available and working as expected.
loc_automoc_macro_names: A semicolon-separated list  of macro names used by AUTOMOC to determine if a C++ file needs to be processed by moc.
loc_automoc_moc_options: Additional options for moc when using AUTOMOC
loc_automoc_path_prefix: When this property is ON, CMake will generate the -p path prefix option for moc on AUTOMOC enabled Qt targets.
loc_autorcc: Should the target be processed with auto-rcc (for Qt projects).
loc_autorcc_executable: AUTORCC_EXECUTABLE is file path pointing to the rcc executable to use for AUTORCC enabled files. Setting this property will make CMake skip the automatic detection of the rcc binary as well as the sanity-tests normally run to ensure that the binary is available and working as expected.
loc_autouic: Should the target be processed with auto-uic (for Qt projects).
loc_autouic_executable: AUTOUIC_EXECUTABLE is file path pointing to the uic executable to use for AUTOUIC enabled files. Setting this property will make CMake skip the automatic detection of the uic binary as well as the sanity-tests normally run to ensure that the binary is available and working as expected.
loc_autouic_search_paths: Search path list used by AUTOUIC to find included .ui files.
loc_build_rpath: A semicolon-separated list  specifying runtime path (RPATH) entries to add to binaries linked in the build tree (for platforms that support it). By default, CMake sets the runtime path of binaries in the build tree to contain search paths it knows are needed to find the shared libraries they link. Projects may set BUILD_RPATH to specify additional search paths.
loc_build_rpath_use_origin: Whether to use relative paths for the build RPATH.
loc_build_with_install_name_dir: BUILD_WITH_INSTALL_NAME_DIR is a boolean specifying whether the macOS install_name of a target in the build tree uses the directory given by INSTALL_NAME_DIR. This setting only applies to targets on macOS.
loc_build_with_install_rpath: BUILD_WITH_INSTALL_RPATH is a boolean specifying whether to link the target in the build tree with the INSTALL_RPATH. This takes precedence over SKIP_BUILD_RPATH and avoids the need for relinking before installation.
loc_bundle: This target is a CFBundle on the macOS.
loc_bundle_extension: The file extension used to name a BUNDLE, a FRAMEWORK, or a MACOSX_BUNDLE target on the macOS and iOS.
loc_common_language_runtime: By setting this target property, the target is configured to build with C++/CLI support.
loc_compatible_interface_bool: Properties which must be compatible with their link interface
loc_compatible_interface_number_max: Properties whose maximum value from the link interface will be used.
loc_compatible_interface_number_min: Properties whose minimum value from the link interface will be used.
loc_compatible_interface_string: Properties which must be string-compatible with their link interface
loc_compile_features: Compiler features enabled for this target.
loc_compile_pdb_name: Output name for the MS debug symbol .pdb file generated by the compiler while building source files.
loc_compile_pdb_name_config: Per-configuration output name for the MS debug symbol .pdb file generated by the compiler while building source files.
loc_compile_pdb_output_directory: Output directory for the MS debug symbol .pdb file generated by the compiler while building source files.
loc_compile_pdb_output_directory_config: Per-configuration output directory for the MS debug symbol .pdb file generated by the compiler while building source files.
loc_compile_warning_as_error: Specify whether to treat warnings on compile as errors. If enabled, adds a flag to treat warnings on compile as errors. If the cmake --compile-no-warning-as-error option is given on the cmake command line, this property is ignored.
loc_config_output_name: Old per-configuration target file base name. Use OUTPUT_NAME_ instead.
loc_config_postfix: Postfix to append to the target file name for configuration <CONFIG>.
loc_crosscompiling_emulator: Use the given emulator to run executables created when crosscompiling. This command will be added as a prefix to add_test, add_custom_command, and add_custom_target commands for built target system executables.
loc_cuda_architectures: List of architectures to generate device code for.
loc_cuda_cubin_compilation: Compile CUDA sources to .cubin files instead of .obj files within Object Libraries.
loc_cuda_extensions: Boolean specifying whether compiler specific extensions are requested.
loc_cuda_fatbin_compilation: Compile CUDA sources to .fatbin files instead of .obj files within Object Libraries.
loc_cuda_optix_compilation: Compile CUDA sources to .optixir files instead of .obj files within Object Libraries.
loc_cuda_ptx_compilation: Compile CUDA sources to .ptx files instead of .obj files within Object Libraries.
loc_cuda_resolve_device_symbols: CUDA only: Enables device linking for the specific library target where required.
loc_cuda_runtime_library: Select the CUDA runtime library for use by compilers targeting the CUDA language.
loc_cuda_separable_compilation: CUDA only: Enables separate compilation of device code
loc_cuda_standard: The CUDA/C++ standard whose features are requested to build this target.
loc_cuda_standard_required: Boolean describing whether the value of CUDA_STANDARD is a requirement.
loc_cxx_extensions: Boolean specifying whether compiler specific extensions are requested.
loc_cxx_module_dirs: Semicolon-separated list of base directories of the target's default C++ module set (i.e. the file set with name and type CXX_MODULES). The property supports generator expressions <cmake-generator-expressions(7)>.
loc_cxx_module_dirs_name: Semicolon-separated list of base directories of the target's <NAME> C++ module set, which has the set type CXX_MODULES. The property supports generator expressions <cmake-generator-expressions(7)>.
loc_cxx_module_set: Semicolon-separated list of files in the target's default C++ module set, (i.e. the file set with name and type CXX_MODULES). If any of the paths are relative, they are computed relative to the target's source directory. The property supports generator expressions <cmake-generator-expressions(7)>.
loc_cxx_module_sets: Read-only list of the target's PRIVATE and PUBLIC C++ module sets (i.e. all file sets with the type CXX_MODULES). Files listed in these file sets are treated as source files for the purpose of IDE integration.
loc_cxx_module_set_name: Semicolon-separated list of files in the target's <NAME> C++ module set, which has the set type CXX_MODULES. If any of the paths are relative, they are computed relative to the target's source directory. The property supports generator expressions <cmake-generator-expressions(7)>.
loc_cxx_standard: The C++ standard whose features are requested to build this target.
loc_cxx_standard_required: Boolean describing whether the value of CXX_STANDARD is a requirement.
loc_c_extensions: Boolean specifying whether compiler specific extensions are requested.
loc_c_standard: The C standard whose features are requested to build this target.
loc_c_standard_required: Boolean describing whether the value of C_STANDARD is a requirement.
loc_define_symbol: Define a symbol when compiling this target's sources.
loc_deployment_additional_files: Set the WinCE project AdditionalFiles in DeploymentTool in .vcproj files generated by the Visual Studio 9 2008 generator. This is useful when you want to debug on remote WinCE device. Specify additional files that will be copied to the device. For example:
loc_deployment_remote_directory: Set the WinCE project RemoteDirectory in DeploymentTool and RemoteExecutable in DebuggerTool in .vcproj files generated by the Visual Studio 9 2008 generator. This is useful when you want to debug on remote WinCE device. For example:
loc_deprecation: Deprecation message from imported target's developer.
loc_disable_precompile_headers: Disables the precompilation of header files specified by PRECOMPILE_HEADERS property.
loc_dll_name_with_soversion: This property controls whether the SOVERSION target property is added to the filename of generated DLL filenames for the Windows platform, which is selected when the WIN32 variable is set.
loc_dotnet_sdk: Specify the .NET SDK for C# projects. For example: Microsoft.NET.Sdk.
loc_echostring: A message to be displayed when the target is built.
loc_enable_exports: Specify whether an executable or a shared library exports symbols.
loc_exclude_from_default_build_config: Per-configuration version of target exclusion from Build Solution.
loc_export_compile_commands: Enable/Disable output of compile commands during generation for a target.
loc_export_no_system: This property affects the behavior of the install and export commands when they install or export the target respectively. When EXPORT_NO_SYSTEM is set to true, those commands generate an imported target with SYSTEM property set to false.
loc_export_properties: List additional properties to export for a target.
loc_folder: For IDEs that present targets using a folder hierarchy, this property specifies the name of the folder to place the target under. To nest folders, use FOLDER values such as GUI/Dialogs with / characters separating folder levels. Targets with no FOLDER property will appear as top level entities. Targets with the same FOLDER property value will appear in the same folder as siblings.
loc_fortran_building_instrinsic_modules: Instructs the CMake Fortran preprocessor that the target is building Fortran intrinsics for building a Fortran compiler.
loc_fortran_module_directory: Specify output directory for Fortran modules provided by the target.
loc_framework: Build SHARED or STATIC library as Framework Bundle on the macOS and iOS.
loc_framework_multi_config_postfix_confi: Postfix to append to the framework file name for configuration <CONFIG>, when using a multi-config generator (like Xcode and Ninja Multi-Config).
loc_framework_version: Version of a framework created using the FRAMEWORK target property (e.g. A).
loc_ghs_integrity_app: ON / OFF boolean to determine if an executable target should be treated as an Integrity Application.
loc_ghs_no_source_group_file: ON / OFF boolean to control if the project file for a target should be one single file or multiple files.
loc_gnutoms: Convert GNU import library (.dll.a) to MS format (.lib).
loc_has_cxx: Link the target using the C++ linker tool (obsolete).
loc_header_dirs: Semicolon-separated list of base directories of the target's default header set (i.e. the file set with name and type HEADERS). The property supports generator expressions <cmake-generator-expressions(7)>.
loc_header_dirs_name: Semicolon-separated list of base directories of the target's <NAME> header set, which has the set type HEADERS. The property supports generator expressions <cmake-generator-expressions(7)>.
loc_header_set: Semicolon-separated list of files in the target's default header set, (i.e. the file set with name and type HEADERS). If any of the paths are relative, they are computed relative to the target's source directory. The property supports generator expressions <cmake-generator-expressions(7)>.
loc_header_sets: Read-only list of the target's PRIVATE and PUBLIC header sets (i.e. all file sets with the type HEADERS). Files listed in these file sets are treated as source files for the purpose of IDE integration. The files also have their HEADER_FILE_ONLY property set to TRUE.
loc_header_set_name: Semicolon-separated list of files in the target's <NAME> header set, which has the set type HEADERS. If any of the paths are relative, they are computed relative to the target's source directory. The property supports generator expressions <cmake-generator-expressions(7)>.
loc_hip_architectures: List of GPU architectures to for which to generate device code. Architecture names are interpreted based on CMAKE_HIP_PLATFORM.
loc_hip_extensions: Boolean specifying whether compiler specific extensions are requested.
loc_hip_standard: The HIP/C++ standard requested to build this target.
loc_hip_standard_required: Boolean describing whether the value of HIP_STANDARD is a requirement.
loc_imported: Read-only indication of whether a target is IMPORTED.
loc_imported_common_language_runtime: Property to define if the target uses C++/CLI.
loc_imported_configurations: Configurations provided for an imported target .
loc_imported_cxx_modules_compile_definit: Preprocessor definitions for compiling an IMPORTED target's C++ module sources.
loc_imported_cxx_modules_compile_feature: Compiler features enabled for this IMPORTED target's C++ modules.
loc_imported_cxx_modules_compile_options: List of options to pass to the compiler for this IMPORTED target's C++ modules.
loc_imported_cxx_modules_include_directo: List of preprocessor include file search directories when compiling C++ modules for IMPORTED targets.
loc_imported_cxx_modules_link_libraries: List of direct dependencies to use for usage requirements for C++ modules in the target's C++ modules.
loc_imported_global: Indication of whether an IMPORTED target  is globally visible.
loc_imported_implib: Full path to the import library for an IMPORTED target.
loc_imported_libname: Specify the link library name for an imported  Interface Library .
loc_imported_link_dependent_libraries: Dependent shared libraries of an imported shared library.
loc_imported_link_interface_languages: Languages compiled into an IMPORTED static library.
loc_imported_link_interface_libraries: Transitive link interface of an IMPORTED target.
loc_imported_link_interface_multiplicity: Repetition count for cycles of IMPORTED static libraries.
loc_imported_location: Full path to the main file on disk for an IMPORTED target.
loc_imported_no_soname: Specifies that an IMPORTED shared library target has no soname.
loc_imported_no_system: Setting IMPORTED_NO_SYSTEM to true on an imported target  specifies that it is not a system target. This has the following effects:
loc_imported_objects: A semicolon-separated list  of absolute paths to the object files on disk for an imported  object library .
loc_imported_soname: The soname of an IMPORTED target of shared library type.
loc_import_prefix: What comes before the import library name.
loc_import_suffix: What comes after the import library name.
loc_install_name_dir: Directory name for installed targets on Apple platforms.
loc_install_remove_environment_rpath: Controls whether toolchain-defined rpaths should be removed during installation.
loc_install_rpath: The rpath to use for installed targets.
loc_install_rpath_use_link_path: Add paths to linker search and installed rpath.
loc_interface_automoc_macro_names: A semicolon-separated list  of macro names for AUTOMOC to be propagated to consumers.
loc_interface_autouic_options: List of interface options to pass to uic.
loc_interface_compile_definitions: List of public property_name requirements for a library.
loc_interface_compile_features: List of public property_name requirements for a library.
loc_interface_compile_options: List of public property_name requirements for a library.
loc_interface_cxx_module_sets: Read-only list of the target's PUBLIC C++ module sets (i.e. all file sets with the type CXX_MODULES). Files listed in these C++ module sets can be installed with install and exported with install and export.
loc_interface_header_sets: Read-only list of the target's INTERFACE and PUBLIC header sets (i.e. all file sets with the type HEADERS). Files listed in these header sets can be installed with install and exported with install and export.
loc_interface_header_sets_to_verify: Used to specify which PUBLIC and INTERFACE header sets of a target should be verified.
loc_interface_include_directories: List of public property_name requirements for a library.
loc_interface_link_depends: Additional public interface files on which a target binary depends for linking.
loc_interface_link_directories: List of public property_name requirements for a library.
loc_interface_link_libraries: List public interface libraries for a library.
loc_interface_link_libraries_direct: List of libraries that consumers of this library should treat as direct link dependencies.
loc_interface_link_libraries_direct_excl: List of libraries that consumers of this library should not treat as direct link dependencies.
loc_interface_link_options: List of public property_name requirements for a library.
loc_interface_position_independent_code: Whether consumers need to create a position-independent target
loc_interface_precompile_headers: List of interface header files to precompile into consuming targets.
loc_interface_sources: List of interface sources to compile into consuming targets.
loc_interface_system_include_directories: List of public system include directories for a library.
loc_ios_install_combined: Build a combined (device and simulator) target when installing.
loc_ispc_header_directory: Specify relative output directory for ISPC headers provided by the target.
loc_ispc_header_suffix: Specify output suffix to be used for ISPC generated headers provided by the target.
loc_ispc_instruction_sets: List of instruction set architectures to generate code for.
loc_job_pool_compile: Ninja only: Pool used for compiling.
loc_job_pool_link: Ninja only: Pool used for linking.
loc_job_pool_precompile_header: Ninja only: Pool used for generating pre-compiled headers.
loc_lang_clang_tidy: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX.
loc_lang_clang_tidy_export_fixes_dir: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC or OBJCXX, and only has an effect when <LANG>_CLANG_TIDY is set.
loc_lang_compiler_launcher: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C, CXX, Fortran, HIP, ISPC, OBJC, OBJCXX, or CUDA.
loc_lang_cppcheck: This property is supported only when <LANG> is C or CXX.
loc_lang_cpplint: This property is supported only when <LANG> is C or CXX.
loc_lang_include_what_you_use: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C or CXX.
loc_lang_linker_launcher: This property is implemented only when <LANG> is C, CXX, OBJC, or OBJCXX
loc_lang_visibility_preset: Value for symbol visibility compile flags
loc_library_output_directory: Output directory in which to build XXX target files.
loc_library_output_directory_config: Per-configuration output directory for LIBRARY  target files.
loc_library_output_name: Output name for XXX target files.
loc_library_output_name_config: Per-configuration output name for LIBRARY  target files.
loc_linker_language: Specifies language whose compiler will invoke the linker.
loc_link_depends: Additional files on which a target binary depends for linking.
loc_link_depends_no_shared: Do not depend on linked shared library files.
loc_link_flags: Additional flags to use when linking this target if it is a shared library, module library, or an executable. Static libraries need to use STATIC_LIBRARY_OPTIONS or STATIC_LIBRARY_FLAGS properties.
loc_link_flags_config: Per-configuration linker flags for a SHARED library, MODULE or EXECUTABLE target.
loc_link_interface_libraries: List public interface libraries for a shared library or executable.
loc_link_interface_libraries_config: Per-configuration list of public interface libraries for a target.
loc_link_interface_multiplicity: Repetition count for STATIC libraries with cyclic dependencies.
loc_link_interface_multiplicity_config: Per-configuration repetition count for cycles of STATIC libraries.
loc_link_libraries_only_targets: Enforce that link items that can be target names are actually existing targets.
loc_link_library_override: Override the library features associated with libraries from LINK_LIBRARY generator expressions. This can be used to resolve incompatible library features that result from specifying different features for the same library in different LINK_LIBRARY generator expressions.
loc_link_library_override_library: Override the library feature associated with <LIBRARY> from LINK_LIBRARY generator expressions. This can be used to resolve incompatible library features that result from specifying different features for <LIBRARY> in different LINK_LIBRARY generator expressions.
loc_link_search_end_static: End a link line such that static system libraries are used.
loc_link_search_start_static: Assume the linker looks for static libraries by default.
loc_link_what_you_use: This is a boolean option that, when set to TRUE, will automatically run contents of variable CMAKE_LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE_CHECK on the target after it is linked. In addition, the linker flag specified by variable CMAKE_<LANG>_LINK_WHAT_YOU_USE_FLAG will be passed to the target with the link command so that all libraries specified on the command line will be linked into the target. This will result in the link producing a list of libraries that provide no symbols used by this target but are being linked to it.
loc_location_config: Read-only property providing a target location on disk.
loc_macho_compatibility_version: What compatibility version number is this target for Mach-O binaries.
loc_macho_current_version: What current version number is this target for Mach-O binaries.
loc_macosx_bundle: Build an executable as an Application Bundle on macOS or iOS.
loc_macosx_bundle_info_plist: Specify a custom Info.plist template for a macOS and iOS Application Bundle.
loc_macosx_framework_info_plist: Specify a custom Info.plist template for a macOS and iOS Framework.
loc_macosx_rpath: Whether this target on macOS or iOS is located at runtime using rpaths.
loc_manually_added_dependencies: Get manually added dependencies to other top-level targets.
loc_map_imported_config_config: Map from project configuration to imported target 's configuration.
loc_msvc_debug_information_format: Select debug information format when targeting the MSVC ABI.
loc_msvc_runtime_library: Select the MSVC runtime library for use by compilers targeting the MSVC ABI.
loc_no_soname: Whether to set soname when linking a shared library.
loc_no_system_from_imported: Do not treat include directories from the interfaces of consumed imported targets as system directories.
loc_objcxx_extensions: Boolean specifying whether compiler specific extensions are requested.
loc_objcxx_standard: The ObjC++ standard whose features are requested to build this target.
loc_objcxx_standard_required: Boolean describing whether the value of OBJCXX_STANDARD is a requirement.
loc_objc_extensions: Boolean specifying whether compiler specific extensions are requested.
loc_objc_standard: The OBJC standard whose features are requested to build this target.
loc_objc_standard_required: Boolean describing whether the value of OBJC_STANDARD is a requirement.
loc_optimize_dependencies: Activates dependency optimization of static and object libraries.
loc_osx_architectures_config: Per-configuration macOS and iOS binary architectures for a target.
loc_pch_instantiate_templates: When this property is set to true, the precompiled header compiler options will contain a flag to instantiate templates during the generation of the PCH if supported. This can significantly improve compile times. Supported in Clang since version 11.
loc_pch_warn_invalid: When this property is set to true, the precompile header compiler options will contain a compiler flag which should warn about invalid precompiled headers e.g. -Winvalid-pch for GNU compiler.
loc_pdb_name: Output name for the MS debug symbol .pdb file generated by the linker for an executable or shared library target.
loc_pdb_name_config: Per-configuration output name for the MS debug symbol .pdb file generated by the linker for an executable or shared library target.
loc_pdb_output_directory: Output directory for the MS debug symbols .pdb file generated by the linker for an executable or shared library target.
loc_pdb_output_directory_config: Per-configuration output directory for the MS debug symbol .pdb file generated by the linker for an executable or shared library target.
loc_position_independent_code: Whether to create a position-independent target
loc_precompile_headers: List of header files to precompile.
loc_precompile_headers_reuse_from: Target from which to reuse the precompiled headers build artifact.
loc_prefix: What comes before the library name.
loc_private_header: Specify private header files in a FRAMEWORK shared library target.
loc_project_label: Change the name of a target in an IDE.
loc_public_header: Specify public header files in a FRAMEWORK shared library target.
loc_resource: Specify resource files in a FRAMEWORK or BUNDLE.
loc_runtime_output_directory: Output directory in which to build XXX target files.
loc_runtime_output_directory_config: Per-configuration output directory for RUNTIME  target files.
loc_runtime_output_name: Output name for XXX target files.
loc_runtime_output_name_config: Per-configuration output name for RUNTIME  target files.
loc_skip_build_rpath: Should rpaths be used for the build tree.
loc_sources: This specifies the list of paths to source files for the target. The following commands all set or add to the SOURCES target property and are the usual way to manipulate it:
loc_soversion: What version number is this target.
loc_static_library_flags: Archiver (or MSVC librarian) flags for a static library target. Targets that are shared libraries, modules, or executables need to use the LINK_OPTIONS or LINK_FLAGS target properties.
loc_static_library_flags_config: Per-configuration archiver (or MSVC librarian) flags for a static library target.
loc_static_library_options: Archiver (or MSVC librarian) flags for a static library target. Targets that are shared libraries, modules, or executables need to use the LINK_OPTIONS target property.
loc_suffix: What comes after the target name.
loc_swift_language_version: This property sets the language version for the Swift sources in the target. If one is not specified, it will default to CMAKE_Swift_LANGUAGE_VERSION if specified, otherwise it is the latest version supported by the compiler.
loc_swift_module_directory: Specify output directory for Swift modules provided by the target.
loc_swift_module_name: This property specifies the name of the Swift module. It is defaulted to the name of the target.
loc_unity_build: When this property is set to true, the target source files will be combined into batches for faster compilation. This is done by creating a (set of) unity sources which #include the original sources, then compiling these unity sources instead of the originals. This is known as a Unity or Jumbo build.
loc_unity_build_batch_size: Specifies the maximum number of source files that can be combined into any one unity source file when unity builds are enabled by the UNITY_BUILD target property. The original source files will be distributed across as many unity source files as necessary to honor this limit.
loc_unity_build_code_after_include: Code snippet which is included verbatim by the UNITY_BUILD feature just after every #include statement in the generated unity source files. For example:
loc_unity_build_code_before_include: Code snippet which is included verbatim by the UNITY_BUILD feature just before every #include statement in the generated unity source files. For example:
loc_unity_build_mode: CMake provides different algorithms for selecting which sources are grouped together into a bucket. Selection is decided by this property, which has the following acceptable values:
loc_unity_build_unique_id: The name of a valid C-identifier which is set to a unique per-file value during unity builds.
loc_verify_interface_header_sets: Used to verify that all headers in a target's PUBLIC and INTERFACE header sets can be included on their own.
loc_version: What version number is this target.
loc_visibility_inlines_hidden: Whether to add a compile flag to hide symbols of inline functions
loc_vs_debugger_command: Sets the local debugger command for Visual Studio C++ targets. The property value may use generator expressions <cmake-generator-expressions(7)>. This is defined in <LocalDebuggerCommand> in the Visual Studio project file. This property is initialized by the value of the variable CMAKE_VS_DEBUGGER_COMMAND if it is set when a target is created.
loc_vs_debugger_command_arguments: Sets the local debugger command line arguments for Visual Studio C++ targets. The property value may use generator expressions <cmake-generator-expressions(7)>. This is defined in <LocalDebuggerCommandArguments> in the Visual Studio project file. This property is initialized by the value of the variable CMAKE_VS_DEBUGGER_COMMAND_ARGUMENTS if it is set when a target is created.
loc_vs_debugger_environment: Sets the local debugger environment for Visual Studio C++ targets. The property value may use generator expressions <cmake-generator-expressions(7)>. This is defined in <LocalDebuggerEnvironment> in the Visual Studio project file. This property is initialized by the value of the variable CMAKE_VS_DEBUGGER_ENVIRONMENT if it is set when a target is created.
loc_vs_debugger_working_directory: Sets the local debugger working directory for Visual Studio C++ targets. The property value may use generator expressions <cmake-generator-expressions(7)>. This is defined in <LocalDebuggerWorkingDirectory> in the Visual Studio project file. This property is initialized by the value of the variable CMAKE_VS_DEBUGGER_WORKING_DIRECTORY if it is set when a target is created.
loc_vs_desktop_extensions_version: Visual Studio Windows 10 Desktop Extensions Version
loc_vs_dotnet_documentation_file: Visual Studio managed project .NET documentation output
loc_vs_dotnet_referenceprop_refname_tag_: Defines an XML property <tagname> for a .NET reference <refname>.
loc_vs_dotnet_references_copy_local: Sets the Copy Local property for all .NET hint references in the target
loc_vs_dotnet_reference_refname: Visual Studio managed project .NET reference with name <refname> and hint path.
loc_vs_dotnet_startup_object: Sets the startup object property in Visual Studio .NET targets. The property value defines a full qualified class name (including package name), for example: MyCompany.Package.MyStarterClass.
loc_vs_dpi_aware: Set the Manifest Tool -> Input and Output -> DPI Awareness in the Visual Studio target project properties.
loc_vs_global_keyword: Visual Studio project keyword for VS 10 (2010) and newer.
loc_vs_iot_extensions_version: Visual Studio Windows 10 IoT Extensions Version
loc_vs_iot_startup_task: Visual Studio Windows 10 IoT Continuous Background Task
loc_vs_just_my_code_debugging: Enable Just My Code with Visual Studio debugger.
loc_vs_keyword: Visual Studio project keyword for VS 9 (2008) and older.
loc_vs_mobile_extensions_version: Visual Studio Windows 10 Mobile Extensions Version
loc_vs_no_compile_batching: Turn off compile batching for the target. Usually MSBuild calls the compiler with multiple c/cpp files and compiler starts subprocesses for each file to make the build parallel. If you want compiler to be invoked with one file at a time set VS_NO_COMPILE_BATCHING to ON. If this flag is set MSBuild will call compiler with one c/cpp file at a time. Useful when you want to use tool that replaces the compiler, for example some build caching tool.
loc_vs_no_solution_deploy: Specify that the target should not be marked for deployment to a Windows CE or Windows Phone device in the generated Visual Studio solution.
loc_vs_package_references: Visual Studio package references for nuget.
loc_vs_platform_toolset: Overrides the platform toolset used to build a target.
loc_vs_scc_auxpath: Visual Studio Source Code Control Aux Path.
loc_vs_scc_localpath: Visual Studio Source Code Control Local Path.
loc_vs_scc_projectname: Visual Studio Source Code Control Project.
loc_vs_scc_provider: Visual Studio Source Code Control Provider.
loc_vs_sdk_references: Visual Studio project SDK references. Specify a semicolon-separated list  of SDK references to be added to a generated Visual Studio project, e.g. Microsoft.AdMediatorWindows81, Version=1.0.
loc_vs_solution_deploy: Specify that the target should be marked for deployment when not targeting Windows CE, Windows Phone or a Windows Store application.
loc_vs_source_settings_tool: Set any item metadata on all non-built files that use <tool>.
loc_vs_user_props: Sets the user props file to be included in the visual studio C++ project file. The standard path is $(UserRootDir)\\Microsoft.Cpp.$(Platform).user.props, which is in most cases the same as %LOCALAPPDATA%\\Microsoft\\MSBuild\\v4.0\\Microsoft.Cpp.Win32.user.props or %LOCALAPPDATA%\\Microsoft\\MSBuild\\v4.0\\Microsoft.Cpp.x64.user.props.
loc_vs_windows_target_platform_min_versi: Visual Studio Windows Target Platform Minimum Version
loc_vs_winrt_component: Mark a target as a Windows Runtime component for the Visual Studio generator. Compile the target with C++/CX language extensions for Windows Runtime. For SHARED and MODULE libraries, this also defines the _WINRT_DLL preprocessor macro.
loc_vs_winrt_extensions: Deprecated. Use VS_WINRT_COMPONENT instead. This property was an experimental partial implementation of that one.
loc_vs_winrt_references: Visual Studio project Windows Runtime Metadata references
loc_watcom_runtime_library: Select the Watcom runtime library for use by compilers targeting the Watcom ABI.
loc_win32_executable: Build an executable with a WinMain entry point on windows.
loc_windows_export_all_symbols: This property is implemented only for MS-compatible tools on Windows.
loc_xcode_embed_frameworks_code_sign_on_: Tell the Xcode generator to perform code signing for all the frameworks and libraries that are embedded using the XCODE_EMBED_FRAMEWORKS <XCODE_EMBED_<type>> property.
loc_xcode_embed_frameworks_remove_header: Tell the Xcode generator to remove headers from all the frameworks that are embedded using the XCODE_EMBED_FRAMEWORKS <XCODE_EMBED_<type>> property.
loc_xcode_embed_type: Tell the Xcode generator to embed the specified list of items into the target bundle. <type> specifies the embed build phase to use. See the Xcode documentation for the base location of each <type>.
loc_xcode_embed_type_code_sign_on_copy: Boolean property used only by the Xcode generator. It specifies whether to perform code signing for the items that are embedded using the XCODE_EMBED_ property.
loc_xcode_embed_type_path: This property is used only by the Xcode generator. When defined, it specifies the relative path to use when embedding the items specified by XCODE_EMBED_. The path is relative to the base location of the Embed XXX build phase associated with <type>. See the Xcode documentation for the base location of each <type>.
loc_xcode_embed_type_remove_headers_on_c: Boolean property used only by the Xcode generator. It specifies whether to remove headers from all the frameworks that are embedded using the XCODE_EMBED_ property.
loc_xcode_generate_scheme: If enabled, the Xcode generator will generate schema files. These are useful to invoke analyze, archive, build-for-testing and test actions from the command line.
loc_xcode_link_build_phase_mode: When using the Xcode generator, libraries to be linked will be specified in the Xcode project file using either the "Link Binary With Libraries" build phase or directly as linker flags. The former allows Xcode to manage build paths, which may be necessary when creating Xcode archives because it may use different build paths to a regular build.
loc_xcode_product_type: Set the Xcode productType attribute on its reference to a target. CMake computes a default based on target type but can be told explicitly with this property.
loc_xcode_scheme_address_sanitizer: Whether to enable Address Sanitizer in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_xcode_scheme_address_sanitizer_use_a: Whether to enable Detect use of stack after return in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_xcode_scheme_arguments: Specify command line arguments that should be added to the Arguments section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_xcode_scheme_debug_as_root: Whether to debug the target as 'root'.
loc_xcode_scheme_debug_document_versioni: Whether to enable Allow debugging when using document Versions Browser in the Options section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_xcode_scheme_disable_main_thread_che: Whether to disable the Main Thread Checker in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_xcode_scheme_dynamic_library_loads: Whether to enable Dynamic Library Loads in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_xcode_scheme_dynamic_linker_api_usag: Whether to enable Dynamic Linker API usage in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_xcode_scheme_enable_gpu_api_validati: Property value for Metal: API Validation in the Options section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_xcode_scheme_enable_gpu_frame_captur: Property value for GPU Frame Capture in the Options section of the generated Xcode scheme. Example values are Metal and Disabled.
loc_xcode_scheme_enable_gpu_shader_valid: Property value for Metal: Shader Validation in the Options section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_xcode_scheme_environment: Specify environment variables that should be added to the Arguments section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_xcode_scheme_executable: Specify path to executable in the Info section of the generated Xcode scheme. If not set the schema generator will select the current target if it is actually executable.
loc_xcode_scheme_guard_malloc: Whether to enable Guard Malloc in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_xcode_scheme_launch_configuration: Set the build configuration to run the target.
loc_xcode_scheme_launch_mode: Property value for Launch in the Info section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_xcode_scheme_main_thread_checker_sto: Whether to enable the Main Thread Checker option Pause on issues in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_xcode_scheme_malloc_guard_edges: Whether to enable Malloc Guard Edges in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_xcode_scheme_malloc_scribble: Whether to enable Malloc Scribble in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_xcode_scheme_malloc_stack: Whether to enable Malloc Stack in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_xcode_scheme_thread_sanitizer: Whether to enable Thread Sanitizer in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_xcode_scheme_thread_sanitizer_stop: Whether to enable Thread Sanitizer - Pause on issues in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_xcode_scheme_undefined_behaviour_san: Whether to enable Undefined Behavior Sanitizer in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.
Whether to enable Undefined Behavior Sanitizer option Pause on issues in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_xcode_scheme_working_directory: Specify the Working Directory of the Run and Profile actions in the generated Xcode scheme. In case the value contains generator expressions those are evaluated.
loc_xcode_scheme_zombie_objects: Whether to enable Zombie Objects in the Diagnostics section of the generated Xcode scheme.
loc_xcode_xcconfig: If set, the Xcode generator will register the specified file as a target-level XCConfig file. For global XCConfig files see the CMAKE_XCODE_XCCONFIG variable.
loc_xctest: This target is a XCTest CFBundle on the Mac.
